till he came to the rising of the Sun, he noted it rising on a people for whom We had not provided any shelter from it (they were so backward that they did not even know how to make houses or tents for their living).
He left them as they were: We had full knowledge what priority was before him.
Then he set out on another expedition and marched on
till he reached between two mountains where he found a people who could hardly understand his language.
They requested: "O Zul-Qarnain! People of Gog and Magog ravage this land; should we pay you tribute in order for you to build a wall-barrier between us and them?"
Zul-Qarnain said: "That which my Rabb has granted me is more than enough, just help me with worker-force and I will erect a fortified barrier between you and them.

Bring me panels of iron." Finally when he had dammed up the space between the two mountains, he said: "Ply your bellows." They did so until the iron wall became red hot, then he said: "Bring me some molten brass to pour over it."
This became such a barrier that Gog and Magog could not scale it or to dig through it.
He said: "This is a blessing from my Rabb. But you should know that when the promise of my Rabb shall come to pass, He will level it to the ground, for the promise of my Rabb is ever true."
On that Day We shall let the people loose to surge like waves on one another. The trumpet will be blown and We shall assemble the mankind all together.
We shall spread Hell out on display before the unbelievers,
who had turned a blind eye to My admonition and a deaf ear to My warning.
Do the unbelievers think that they can take my servants as protectors, to save themselves from Hell, instead of Me? Certainly We have prepared Hell for the entertainment of such unbelievers.
O Muhammad tell them: "Should we tell you the worst kind of losers relating to their deeds?
Those whose all efforts in this worldly life had gone astray from the Right Way, but all along they were under the delusion that they were doing good deeds;

they are the ones who are disregarding the revelations of their Rabb and the fact that they will meet Him for accountability of their deeds in the Hereafter, so their deeds will become null and will not carry any weight on the Day of Judgment.
Thus the reward of such people will be Hell; because they had no faith and because they took My revelations and My Rasools as a joke.
However, those who believe and do good deeds, they will be entertained with the Gardens of Paradise
to live therein for ever and they will never desire to go anywhere else.

O Muhammad tell them: "If the ocean were ink with which to write the words of my Rabb, the ocean would surely be consumed before the words of my Rabb are finished, even if We brought similar quantity of ink to replenish it.

O Muhammad, tell them: "I am but a human being like you; the revelation is sent to me to declare that your God is One God; therefore, whoever hopes to meet his Rabb, let him do good deeds and join no other deity in the worship of his Rabb."
Kaf Ha' Ya' 'Ayn Suad.
This is a reminder of blessings that your Rabb bestowed on His\n\t\t\tservant Zakariya,
when he invoked his Rabb in secret,
saying: "O Rabb! Surely my bones have weakened and the hair of my\n\t\t\thead glisten with grey, while I have never been disappointed in\n\t\t\tmy prayer to You, O Rabb!
Yet I fear about my relatives after me, for my wife is barren,\n\t\t\tgrant me a heir by Your grace
who should inherit me and inherit the posterity of Ya'qoob, and\n\t\t\tmake him, O my Rabb, a desirable person!"
We answered his prayer saying: "O Zakariya! Surely We give you\n\t\t\tthe good news of a son, his name shall be Yahya (John): a name\n\t\t\tthat no one has had before him".
He asked: "O Rabb! How shall I have a son when my wife is barren\n\t\t\tand I have become impotent from old age?"
The answer came: "So shall it be. Your Rabb says: 'It shall not\n\t\t\tbe a difficult task for Me, just as I created you before, when\n\t\t\tyou were nothing at all!"
Zakariya said "O my Rabb! Give me a Sign". He said: "Your sign is\n\t\t\tthat for three nights you shall not be able to speak to the\n\t\t\tpeople even being sound in health".
After this Zakariya came out of the shrine and asked his people,\n\t\t\tthrough sign language, to glorify Allah in the morning and in the\n\t\t\tevening.
To Yahya, when he became old enough, We said: " Hold firmly to\n\t\t\tthe Book." We granted him wisdom, while he was yet a boy,
and also granted him kindness and purity by Our grace, and he\n\t\t\tgrew up a pious man;
dutiful to his parents - he was neither arrogant nor disobedient.
Peace be on him the day he was born, the day of his death and the\n\t\t\tDay he will be raised to life again!
O Muhammad, relate to them the story of Maryam in the Book (The\n\t\t\tQur'an) when she withdrew from her family to a place in the East.
She chose to be secluded from them. We sent to her Our angel and\n\t\t\the appeared before her as a grown up man.
She said: "I seek Rahman's (Allah's) protection against you,\n\t\t\tleave me alone if you are Godfearing".
He said: "Don't be afraid, I am merely a messenger from your Rabb\n\t\t\tto tell you about the gift of a holy son".
She said: "How shall I bear a son, no man has ever touched me nor\n\t\t\tam I unchaste?"
The angel replied: "So shall it be - Your Rabb says: `It is easy\n\t\t\tfor Me. We wish to make him a Sign for mankind and a blessing\n\t\t\tfrom Us' - and this matter has already been decreed".
So she conceived the child and she retired with him to a remote\n\t\t\tplace.
The pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm-tree.\n\t\t\tShe cried in her anguish: "Ah! Would that I had died before this,\n\t\t\tand been long forgotten!"
An angel from beneath the palm-tree consoled her, saying: "Do not\n\t\t\tgrieve! Your Rabb has provided a brook at your feet.
If you shake the trunk of this palm-tree, it will drop fresh ripe\n\t\t\tdates in your lap.
So eat, drink and refresh yourself. If you see anyone, tell him:\n\t\t\t`I have vowed a fast to Rahman (Allah), so I will not speak to\n\t\t\tanyone today'."
Carrying the baby, she came back to her people. They said: "O\n\t\t\tMaryam! You have brought something hard to believe!
O sister (a woman from the noble family) of Haroon! Your father\n\t\t\twas not a bad man nor your mother an unchaste woman".
In response she merely pointed towards the baby. They said: "How\n\t\t\tcan we talk to a babe in the cradle?"
Whereupon the baby spoke out: "I am indeed a servant of Allah. He\n\t\t\thas given me the Book and made me a Prophet.
His blessing is with me wherever I go. He has commanded me to\n\t\t\testablish Salah and give Zakah as long as I shall live.
He has exhorted me to honor my mother and has not made me\n\t\t\tdomineering, hard to deal with.
Peace be upon me the day I was born, the day I shall die and the\n\t\t\tDay I shall be raised to life again".
Such was Isa (Jesus) the son of Maryam, and this is the True\n\t\t\tstatement about him concerning which they are in doubt.

It is not befitting to the majesty of Allah that He Himself
			should beget a son! He is far above this (weakness to get a son
			for name, fame, help or continuity of race); for when He decrees
			a matter He need only say: "Be" and it is.
Isa declared, Verily Allah is my Rabb and your Rabb: therefore\n\t\t\tserve Him. This is a Right Way.
Inspite of this, the sects from among them are divided concerning\n\t\t\tJesus. So woe to the disbelievers who shall be punished after\n\t\t\twitnessing this Truth on the Great Day of Judgement.

They will be able to see and hear very clearly on that Day when\n\t\t\tthey will appear before Us! But today these wrong doers, neither\n\t\t\twant to hear nor see the Truth and, are in manifest error.
O Muhammad, forewarn them about the Day of intense regret when\n\t\t\tthis matter will be decided, even though at present they are\n\t\t\tpaying no heed and do not believe.
Ultimately, all things will perish and it is We, Who will inherit\n\t\t\tthe earth and all that is on it, and to Us shall they return.
Relate to them the story of Ibrahim from the Book (The Qur'an),\n\t\t\the was a truthful Prophet.
Remember when he said to his father: "O my father! Why do you\n\t\t\tworship something that can neither hear nor see, nor yet profit\n\t\t\tyou in any way?
O my father! I have been given some knowledge which has not come\n\t\t\tto you, so follow me: I'll guide you to the Right Way.
O my father! Do not worship Shaitan: for Shaitan is disobedient\n\t\t\tto the Compassionate (Allah).
O my father! I fear that a punishment of the Beneficent may\n\t\t\tafflict you, and you may become a friend of the Shaitan".
His father replied: "How dare you renounce my gods O Ibrahim? If\n\t\t\tyou do not stop this folly, I will indeed stone you to death: so\n\t\t\tbe gone from my house this very moment!"
Ibrahim said: "Peace be upon you: I will pray to my Rabb for your\n\t\t\tforgiveness, surely He is ever Kind to me.
I am leaving you and those whom you invoke besides Allah: I will\n\t\t\tcall upon my Rabb and I am sure my prayers to my Rabb will not be\n\t\t\tignored".
So when he left them and the deities whom they worshipped besides\n\t\t\tAllah, We granted him descendants like Ishaq and Ya'qoob, and We\n\t\t\tmade each of them a Prophet.
We bestowed on them Our Mercy and We granted them honor of being\n\t\t\tmentioned with true high respect.
Relate to them the story of Musa in the Book; surely he was a\n\t\t\tchosen man and was a Rasool, a Prophet.
We called him from the right side of Mount Tur and honored him to\n\t\t\tcome closer for exclusive conversation.
We made his brother Haroon a Prophet with Our blessing and\n\t\t\tassigned him as his assistant.
Also relate to them the story of Isma`il in the Book; he was a\n\t\t\tman of his word and was a Rasool, a Prophet.
He commanded his people to establish Salah and give Zakah, and\n\t\t\twas the one with whom his Rabb was well pleased.
Also relate to them the story of Idris in the Book; he was a\n\t\t\tTruthful man, a Prophet.
Whom We raised to a lofty place.

These are some of the Prophets on whom Allah bestowed His favors
			from among the descendants of Adam and of those whom We carried
			in the Ark with Nuh, and of the descendants of Ibrahim and
			Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. Whenever the
			Revelations of the Compassionate (Allah) were recited to them,
			they fell to prostrate and weep.
But the generations who succeeded them abandoned the Salah and\n\t\t\tstarted following their lusts; so they will soon face the\n\t\t\tconsequences of their deviation.
However, those who repent, become believers and do good deeds,\n\t\t\twill be admitted to Paradise and will not be wronged in the\n\t\t\tleast.
They will be granted the Gardens of Eden which the Merciful has\n\t\t\tpromised to His servants, even though they have not seen them,\n\t\t\tand His promise shall be fulfilled.
There they will hear no nonsense, but only the words of peace;\n\t\t\tand they will be provided their sustenance day and night.
Such is the Paradise which We shall give as an inheritance to\n\t\t\tthose of Our Servants who lead a pious life.

The angle Gabriel who brought this revelation after a long
			interval said: "We do not descend from heaven except by the
			command of your Rabb; to Him belongs whatever is before us and
			whatever is behind us and all that lies in between. Your Rabb is
			never forgetful.
He is the Rabb of the heavens and the earth, and of all that lies\n\t\t\tin between, so worship Him, be steadfast in His worship. Do you\n\t\t\tknow any other being with the qualities like Him?"
Man says: "What! Once I am dead, shall I be raised to life\n\t\t\tagain?"
Does not the man remember that We created him before out of\n\t\t\tnothing?
By your Rabb, We will call them to account in the company of all\n\t\t\ttheir shaitans and set them on their knees around the Fire of\n\t\t\tHell;
then from every sect We will certainly drag out its stoutest\n\t\t\trebels against the Compassionate (Allah).
Certainly We know best who deserves most to be burned therein.
There is not a single one of you, who shall not pass over it,\n\t\t\tthis absolute decree of your Rabb is unavoidable;
then We will deliver those who were pious during their life on\n\t\t\tearth and leave the wrongdoers therein humbled on their knees.
When Our Clear Revelations are recited to them the unbelievers\n\t\t\tsay to the believer: "Which one, of the two of us, have fine\n\t\t\tdwelling and better companions?"
Don't they see, how many generations have We destroyed before\n\t\t\tthem, who were far greater in riches and in splendor?

Tell them: "Anyone who has gone astray, the Compassionate (Allah)
			prolongs his respite and extends an opportunity until they see
			about which they were warned; - be it a worldly scourge or the
			Hour of Doom - then they will realize whose is the worst dwelling
			and whose are the weak companions?

In fact, Allah increases in guidance those who seek guidance;
			everlasting are only the good deeds, which are the best in the
			sight of your Rabb to earn you a better reward and yield you the
			best fruit?"
Have you noticed the words of that person who rejects Our\n\t\t\tRevelations yet boasts: "I shall always be given wealth and\n\t\t\tchildren".
Has he gained knowledge of the Unseen or has he been awarded a\n\t\t\tcontract by the Compassionate (Allah)?
By no means! We write down what he says and We will make his\n\t\t\tpunishment long and terrible.
We will inherit all that he boasts of, and he will come back to\n\t\t\tUs all alone leaving all these things behind.
They have taken other deities for worship besides Allah, so that\n\t\t\tthey should be a source of strength to them.
By no means! Those very deities will renounce their worship and\n\t\t\tturn against them on the Day of Judgement.
Don't you see that We have sent down to the unbelievers shaitans\n\t\t\twho incite them against the Truth?
Therefore be not in haste against them, their days are numbered.
The Day will surely come when We will gather the righteous like\n\t\t\thonored guests before the Compassionate (Allah),
and drive the criminals to Hell like thirsty cattle are driven to\n\t\t\twater.
None shall have the power to intercede except the one who may\n\t\t\treceive the sanction of the Compassionate (Allah).
Those who say: "The Compassionate (God) has begotten a son,
" certainly preach such a monstrous falsehood,
that the very Heavens might crack, the earth might cleave asunder\n\t\t\tand the mountains might crumble to pieces
- at their ascribing a son to the Compassionate (God),
It is not befitting to the Compassionate (God) that He should\n\t\t\tbeget a son.
There is none in the heavens and in the earth but must come to\n\t\t\tthe Compassionate (Allah) in full submission.
He has a comprehensive knowledge and has kept strict count of all\n\t\t\tHis creatures,
and every one of them will come to Him individually on the Day of\n\t\t\tResurrection.
Surely the Beneficent will bring about love for those who believe\n\t\t\tand do good deeds.
We have made this Qur'an easy in your own language so that you\n\t\t\tmay give good news to the righteous and warn the headstrong\n\t\t\tcontentious folk.
How many generations have We destroyed before them! Can you see\n\t\t\tany of them, or hear even a sound of them?
Tua Ha.
We have not sent down this Qur'an to put you in trouble,
but as a reminder to those who fear Allah.
This is a revelation from Him Who has created the earth and the\n\t\t\tlofty Heavens,
the Beneficent (Allah) Who is firmly established on the throne of\n\t\t\tauthority,
to Him belongs whatever is in the Heavens and in the earth, and\n\t\t\tall that lies between them, and all that is beneath the soil.
The One to Whom you need not speak aloud; for He knows what is\n\t\t\tsaid in secret and what is yet more hidden.
He is Allah! There is no deity worthy of worship except Him! To\n\t\t\tHim belong the most beautiful Names.
Have you heard the story of Musa?
When he saw a fire, he said to his family: "Stop: I saw a fire. I\n\t\t\tmay be able to bring some fire or find someone beside the fire to\n\t\t\tguide us towards the right direction."
When he reached there, he was called: "O Musa!
In fact, I am your Rabb! Take off your shoes, you are in the\n\t\t\tsacred valley of Tuwa.
I have chosen you, so listen to what I am about to reveal.
It is Me, Allah; there is none worthy of worship except Me, so\n\t\t\tworship Me and establish Salah for My remembrance.
The final Hour is sure to come, I choose to keep it hidden, so\n\t\t\tthat every soul may be rewarded according to its efforts.
Therefore, let not any, who does not believe in this fact and\n\t\t\tfollow his own desires, turn your away, lest you should perish."
"O Musa what is in your right hand?"
Musa replied: "It is my staff; I lean on it, I beat down fodder\n\t\t\twith it for my flocks and I have also other uses for it".
Allah said "Toss it down O Musa".
So he toss it down and saw that it became a snake active in\n\t\t\tmotion.
Allah said: "Catch it and don't be afraid, We shall change it to\n\t\t\tits original shape.
Now put your hand under your armpit, it shall become shining\n\t\t\twhite without hurting you, this will be another Sign.
These miracles are given to you, in order to show you some of Our\n\t\t\tGreat Signs.
Now go to Fir'on (Pharaoh) for he has indeed transgressed all\n\t\t\tbounds."
Musa prayed: "O Rabb! Open my heart,
ease my task
and remove the impediment from my speech
so that people may understand what I say
and grant me a minister from my family;
Haroon my brother.
Grant me strength through him
and let him share my task,
so that we may glorify You frequently
and mention You often;
for You are the One Who has always been watching over us."
Allah responded: "Your request is granted, O Musa.
We had indeed bestowed a favor on you before,
when We revealed Our will to your mother saying:

'Put your child into the chest and throw the chest into the
			river. The river will cast him on to the bank and he will be
			picked up by one who is an enemy to Me and an enemy to him'. I
			made you an object of love and so arranged things that you may be
			brought up under My supervision.

Recall when your sister went to them and said: `May I tell you of
			the one who can take care of this child?' Thus did We return you
			back to your mother to comfort her eyes and that she might not
			grieve. Again when you killed a man, We saved you from great
			distress and We tested you through various trials. You stayed a
			number of years with the people of Median. Now you have come here
			per Our pre-estimation, O Musa.
I have moulded you for My service.
You and your brother should go with My Signs and do not neglect\n\t\t\tto mention Me.
Go both of you to Fir'on, for he has indeed transgressed all\n\t\t\tbounds.
Speak to him in gentle words; perhaps he may take heed of the\n\t\t\treminder or fear Our punishment."
Musa and Haroon said: "Our Rabb! We fear that he may behave\n\t\t\ttowards us unjustly or may cross all bounds."
Allah said: "Do not be afraid, I shall be with you both. I hear\n\t\t\teverything and see everything.

So go to him and say `Surely we both are Rasools of your Rabb.
			Let the Children of Israel go with us and oppress them no more.
			We have brought you a Sign from your Rabb; may peace be upon him
			who follows the guidance.
Indeed it has been revealed to us that the scourge will fall on\n\t\t\tthose who deny this fact and turns away'."
When Musa and Haroon went to Fir'on and delivered this message ,\n\t\t\the said: "Well, who is your Rabb O Musa?"
Musa replied: "Our Rabb is He Who has given a distinctive form to\n\t\t\tall creatures and then rightly guided them."
Fir'on asked: "What do you say about the condition of previous\n\t\t\tgenerations?"
Musa replied: "That knowledge is with my Rabb, duly recorded in a\n\t\t\tBook. He neither makes a mistake nor does He forget."

He is the One Who has made the earth a cradle for you, traced the\n\t\t\troads on it for you to walk on; and sends down water from the sky\n\t\t\twith which We produce pairs of various kinds of vegetation
- eat from these yourselves and pasture your cattle. Surely there\n\t\t\tare Signs in it for those who use their brains.
We have created you from the earth, into it We shall return you\n\t\t\tand from it We shall bring you back to life once again.
We showed Fir'on all kinds of Our Signs, but he denied them and\n\t\t\tgave no heed.
He said: "Have you come to drive us out of our land with your\n\t\t\tmagic O Musa?

Well, we will confront you with magic to match yours! Let us fix\n\t\t\ta day when both of us should meet, neither we nor you shall fail\n\t\t\tto keep it, in a place where both shall have even chances."
Musa replied: "Let it be the Day of Festival and let the people\n\t\t\tbe assembled before noon".
Fir'on then withdrew, concerted his plan and came back.

Musa addressed them saying: "Woe to you for this challenge! Do
			not forge a lie against Allah by calling it a magic, lest He
			destroy you by a scourge; for whosoever forge a lie will indeed
			be disappointed."
Hearing this, they debated their case among themselves,\n\t\t\twhispering to one another.
Finally they said: "These two (Musa and Haroon) are certainly\n\t\t\texpert magicians who intend to drive you out from your land with\n\t\t\ttheir magic and to do away with your best traditions.
Therefore, muster up all devices and face them with a united\n\t\t\tfront." Finally when the day of confrontation came, Fir'on said:\n\t\t\t" Whoever comes out victorious this day shall prevail."
The magicians said: "O Musa! Will you throw down first or shall\n\t\t\twe?"
Musa replied: "Go ahead, throw down first". Suddenly it appeared\n\t\t\tto Musa as if their cords and staffs were moving about because of\n\t\t\ttheir magic,
and Musa conceived fear within himself.
We said: "Do not be afraid! You will surely come out on top.

Throw that which is in your right hand. It will swallow up every
			thing they have produced. What they have produced is nothing but
			a magician's trick, and a magician can never succeed against a
			miracle no matter how skillful he may be."

When the magicians saw the serpent of Musa swallowing all their
			display, being professionals they knew that it was not magic, so
			the magicians humbled themselves by prostrating and said: "We
			believe in the Rabb of Haroon and Musa."

Fir'on said: "How do you dare to believe in Him without my
			permission? This man must be your master, who taught you
			witchcraft. Well, I will cut off your hands and feet on alternate
			sides and crucify you on trunks of palm-trees; then you will know
			which one of us can give a more terrible and more lasting
			punishment."

The magicians replied: "We can never prefer you, rather we prefer
			the miracle which we have witnessed and Him Who has created us.
			Therefore do whatever you will; you can only punish us in this
			worldly life.
As for us, we have believed in our Rabb so that He may forgive us\n\t\t\tour sins and the magic you have forced us to practice. Better is\n\t\t\tthe ever lasting reward of Allah."
Surely he who will come to his Rabb as a sinner shall be\n\t\t\tconsigned to Hell - wherein he shall neither die nor live.
While he who will come to Him as a believer and has done good\n\t\t\tdeeds shall have the highest ranks
- Gardens of Eden, beneath which rivers flow, live therein\n\t\t\tforever; such is the reward of those who purify themselves from\n\t\t\tevil.

We sent Our revelation to Musa, saying: "Set forth with my
			servants at night and strike a dry path for them through the sea
			without fear of being overtaken by Fir'on and without any fear
			while passing through the sea."
Fir'on followed them with his armies but the waters completely\n\t\t\toverwhelmed them as it could overwhelm them.
Thus Fir'on misled his people instead of guiding them aright.

O Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy, We fixed\n\t\t\ta time to grant you The Taurat on the right side of Mount Tur and\n\t\t\tWe sent down to you Manna (sweet dish) and Salva (quail meat)
- saying: "Eat of the good things We have provided for your\n\t\t\tsustenance and do not transgress, lest you should incur My wrath,\n\t\t\tand whoever incurs My wrath is surely bound to perish,
but the one who repents, becomes a believer, does good deeds and\n\t\t\tfollows the Right Way shall be forgiven."
When Musa came to the mount Tur Allah said: "But, why have you\n\t\t\tcome with such a haste ahead of your people, O Musa?"
He replied: "They are close behind me, I hastened to You O Rabb\n\t\t\tso that You may be pleased".
Allah said: "Well listen! We tested your people after you and the\n\t\t\tSamiri (Samaritan) has led them astray."

So Musa returned to his people in a state of anger and sorrow. He
			said: "O my people! Did your Rabb not make a gracious promise to
			you? Did my absence seem too long to you? Or was it to incur the
			wrath of your Rabb that you broke your promise with me?"

They replied: "We broke the promise through no fault of ours. We\n\t\t\twere made to carry the burden of the peoples ornaments and throw\n\t\t\tthem into the fire, thus Samiri suggested, who threw in something
and forged a calf in the shape of a body which produced the\n\t\t\tmooing sound. Then they cried out: `This is your god and the god\n\t\t\tof Musa, but Musa forgot to mention it to you."
What! Could they not see that it did not respond to them and that\n\t\t\tit could neither harm them nor help them?
Haroon had already told them: "O my people! This is but a test\n\t\t\tfor you; for verily your Rabb is the Rahman (Allah): so follow me\n\t\t\tand do as I command you."
They had replied: "We will not abandon its worship until Musa's\n\t\t\treturn."
Then Musa addressed Haroon: " O Haroon! What prevented you from\n\t\t\tfollowing me, when you saw them going astray?
Why did you disobey me?"

Haroon replied: "O son of my mother! Do not seize me by my beard
			nor pull the hair of my head, in fact I was afraid lest you might
			say: `You have caused a division, through civil war, among the
			Children of Israel and did not respect to what I said, 'to keep
			peace'."
Then Musa addressed Samiri: "Now what you have to say about this,\n\t\t\tO Samiri?"

He replied: "I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful of\n\t\t\tdust from the footprint of the Rasool (Angel Gabriel) and threw\n\t\t\tit into the casting of the calf: thus did my soul prompt me."

Musa cursed him: "Get out of here! Now through out your life, you
			will say to other people: `Touch me not'; and you will not escape
			your appointed doom. Behold this god to whom you had become a
			devoted worshipper: we will burn it and scatter its ashes into
			the sea."
Then he addressed his people: "O my people! Your only God is\n\t\t\tAllah, other than Whom there is no god. His knowledge encompasses\n\t\t\tevery thing."
Thus do We relate to you, O Muhammad, some information of the\n\t\t\tpast events; and indeed We have sent you this Reminder (The\n\t\t\tQur'an) from Our Own Self.
Those who reject it, shall bear a heavy burden on the Day of\n\t\t\tResurrection.
For ever shall they bear it, and it will be indeed a very evil\n\t\t\tburden to bear on the Day of Resurrection.
The Day, when the Trumpet will be blown and We shall assemble all\n\t\t\tthe sinners, their eyes will turn blue with terror.
They shall murmur among themselves: "You hardly lived ten days on\n\t\t\tearth".
We know fully well what they will say; the most careful estimator\n\t\t\tamong them will say: "No, you stayed no longer than a day."
They ask you as to what will happen to the mountains. Tell them:\n\t\t\t"My Rabb will crush and scatter them like a fine dust.
He will turn the earth into a plain leveled ground,
wherein you will not see neither any curve nor crease."

- On that Day the people will follow the call of the Caller, no
			one will dare show any crookedness; their voices hushed before
			the Beneficent (Allah), and you shall here nothing but the sound
			of the marching feet.
On that Day, no intercession will avail except the one to whom\n\t\t\tthe Beneficent (Allah) shall grant permission and would like to\n\t\t\tgive him a hearing.
He knows what is before them and what is behind them while they\n\t\t\tdo not encompass any knowledge about Him.
Their faces shall be humbled before the Ever-Living, the\n\t\t\tEver-existent (Allah). The one who is carrying the burden of\n\t\t\tiniquity will be doomed:
but the one who is a believer and does good deeds shall fear no\n\t\t\ttyranny or injustice.
Thus have we sent down this Qur'an in Arabic and clearly\n\t\t\tproclaimed in it some of the warnings so that they may take heed\n\t\t\tor that it may serve as a reminder to them.
High and exalted be Allah, the True King! Do not hasten to recite\n\t\t\tthe Qur'an before its revelation is completely conveyed to you,\n\t\t\tand then say: "O Rabb! Increase my knowledge."
We had taken a covenant from Adam before, but he forgot. We did\n\t\t\tnot find in him firm determination.
When We said to the angels "Prostrate yourselves before Adam",\n\t\t\tthey all prostrated themselves except Iblees (Shaitan),: who\n\t\t\trefused.
Then We said: "O Adam! This Shaitan is a real enemy to you and to\n\t\t\tyour wife. Do not let him get you both out of Paradise and get\n\t\t\tyou in trouble.
Here in Paradise you shall go neither hungry nor naked;
you shall neither suffer from thirst nor from the scorching\n\t\t\theat."
- But Shaitan seduced him saying: "O Adam! Should I show you the\n\t\t\tTree of Immortality and an everlasting kingdom?"

They both end up eating the fruit of the forbidden tree. As a
			result their private parts became apparent to them and they both
			began to cover themselves with the leaves from the Garden. Thus
			did Adam disobey His Rabb and go astray.
Later on Adam repented and his Rabb chose him, accepted his\n\t\t\trepentance and gave him guidance,
but the one who will turn away from My reminder shall live a\n\t\t\tmeager life and We shall raise him back to life as a blind person\n\t\t\ton the Day of Resurrection."
He will say: "O Rabb! Why have you raised me up blind here, while\n\t\t\tI was clear-sighted before?"
Allah will say: "Just as Our revelation came to you and you\n\t\t\tplayed blind; so are you blind today."
Thus do We reward the one who is a transgressor and does not\n\t\t\tbelieve in the revelations of his Rabb. The punishment of the\n\t\t\tHereafter is more terrible and more lasting.

Have these people not learned a lesson that; We have destroyed
			before them many generations in whose ruins they walk through?
			Certainly in these ruins there are Signs for people of
			understanding.
Had it not been already decreed by your Rabb and a term for\n\t\t\trespite been appointed, they would have been punished.

Therefore be patient with what they say. Glorify your Rabb with
			His praise before sunrise and before sunset, glorify Him during
			the hours of the night as well as at the ends of the day, so that
			you may find satisfaction.

Do not strain your eyes with envy regarding the worldly benefits
			We have bestowed on some among them, for with these We seek to
			test them, the lawful provision of your Rabb is better and more
			lasting.
Enjoin Salah on your people and be diligent in its observance. We\n\t\t\tdemand nothing of you; instead We provide you sustenance. Blessed\n\t\t\tshall be the end of the Righteous.
They say: "Why does he (Muhammad) not bring us a Sign from His\n\t\t\tRabb?" Has not a clear Sign (The Qur'an) come to them containing\n\t\t\tall the teachings of the former Scriptures?

Had We destroyed them as punishment before its revelation, they
			would have said: "Our Rabb! If only You had sent us a Rasool, we
			would certainly have followed Your revelations before being
			humiliated and disgraced."
Say: "All are waiting: so wait if you will. Very soon you shall\n\t\t\tfind out, who is following the Right Way and who has been rightly\n\t\t\tguided."
The Day of Accountability for mankind is getting closer and\n\t\t\tcloser, yet they are heedless and are turning away from the\n\t\t\tadmonition.
They listen with ridicule to each fresh warning that comes to\n\t\t\tthem from their Rabb and remain engaged in the sports.

Their hearts are preoccupied with worldly affairs; these
			wrongdoers say to each other in private: "Is this man (Muhammad)
			not a human being like yourselves? Would you follow witchcraft
			with your eyes open?"
Tell them: "My Rabb has knowledge of every word which is spoken\n\t\t\tin the heavens and the earth, and He hears all and knows all."

"Rather," some of them say, "this Qur'an is jumble of dreams!"\n\t\t\tOthers say: "He has made it all up!" And yet others say: "He is a\n\t\t\tpoet!" Let him bring to us a sign as did the former Rasools."
The fact, however, is that even though We showed Signs to the\n\t\t\tprior people, not a single nation before them, which We\n\t\t\tdestroyed, ever believed. Will they believe?

The Rasools which We sent before you, O Muhammad, were also human\n\t\t\tto whom We sent revelation. If you, O objectors, do not know\n\t\t\tthis, then ask the people of the reminder (Jews and Christians).
We did not give them bodies which could survive without food, nor\n\t\t\twere they immortal.
Then We fulfilled Our promise with them: We saved them and those\n\t\t\twhom We pleased, and destroyed the transgressors.
Now, O People, We have sent down to you a Book (The Qur'an) which\n\t\t\tdeals with matters concerning yourselves; why don't you\n\t\t\tunderstand?
How many nations We have destroyed because of their iniquities\n\t\t\tand replaced them by other nations!
When they felt that Our punishment was coming, they took to their\n\t\t\theels and fled.
They were told: "Do not run away. Return to your luxuries of life\n\t\t\tand to your homes, so that you may be asked questions."
They replied: "Woe to us! Indeed we were wrongdoers."
They kept on repeating that statement till We mowed them down,\n\t\t\tleaving no spark of life in them.
Our creation of the heavens and the earth and all that lies\n\t\t\tbetween them is not a game.
Had We meant to make it a play ground, We would have done it by\n\t\t\tOurself, without giving you discretion to do right and wrong, had\n\t\t\tWe ever done so.
Nay! We give falsehood a violent blow with the Truth to knock it\n\t\t\tout and behold! Falsehood vanishes away. Woe be to you, for all\n\t\t\tthe false gods you have invented.
To Him belongs all that exist in the heavens and in the earth;\n\t\t\tand the angels, who are in His very presence, are not too proud\n\t\t\tto serve Him, nor do they feel wearied of His service.
They glorify Him night and day; and do not pause.
Have the earthly deities, that they have taken for worship, the\n\t\t\tpower to raise the dead?

If there were other gods in the heavens or in the earth besides
			Allah, both the heavens and earth would have been in a state of
			disorder. Glory be to Allah, the Lord of the Throne, absolutely
			free is He from the falsehood that they attribute to Him.
He is accountable to none about what He does, but they are\n\t\t\taccountable to Him.

Even then, have they taken other deities for worship besides Him?
			Ask them: "Show us your proof: here is this reminder (Al-Qur'an)
			for the people of my time and it also contains the reminder of
			those before me." But most of them have no knowledge of Reality,
			and that is why they have turned away.
The fact is that to every Rasool whom We sent before you, We\n\t\t\trevealed the same Message: "there is no god but Me, so worship Me\n\t\t\tAlone."
Inspite of receiving that message, they still say: "The\n\t\t\tBeneficent (Allah) has offspring!" Glory be to Him! The angels\n\t\t\tare but His honored servants.
They do not precede Him in speaking and they act according to His\n\t\t\tcommandment.
He knows what is before them and what is behind them and they do\n\t\t\tnot intercede except for the one whom He approves, and for fear\n\t\t\tof Him they tremble.
If any of them were to say: "I am also a deity besides Him," We\n\t\t\twould send him to hell, thus shall We reward the wrongdoers.

Have not the unbelievers ever considered that the skies and the
			earth were once one mass, then We split them asunder? And We have
			created every living thing from water. Will they still not
			believe?
And We have planted mountains on earth lest it should tilt to one\n\t\t\tside with them (the weight of people) and We left between them\n\t\t\topen passages so that they may find the right direction.
And We have made the sky a safe canopy: yet they are heedless to\n\t\t\tthese signs.
He is the One Who has created the night and the day and the sun\n\t\t\tand the moon: all (the celestial bodies) move swiftly in an orbit\n\t\t\tof their own.
O Muhammad, We have not granted immortality to any human before\n\t\t\tyou: so if you are to die, will these unbelievers live forever?
Every soul is bound to have the taste of death. We are putting\n\t\t\tall of you to a test by passing you through bad and good\n\t\t\tconditions, and finally you shall return to Us.

When the unbelievers see you they do not take you but for one to
			be scoffed at, saying: "Is this the one who talks against your
			gods?" And they themselves deny the mention of the Compassionate
			(Allah).
Man is a creature of haste (impatience). Soon I will show you My\n\t\t\tsigns, therefore, you need not be impatient.
They ask: "When will this promise be fulfilled if you are telling\n\t\t\tthe truth?"

They would not have asked this question if only the unbelievers
			knew the Day when they will be able to protect neither their
			faces from the fire of hell nor their backs, nor will they be
			helped!
Nay, it will come to them all of a sudden and overpower them so\n\t\t\tabruptly that they shall neither be able to avert it nor shall\n\t\t\tthey get any respite.
As for their scoffing, the Rasools before you were also scoffed\n\t\t\tat; but their scoffers were hemmed in by the very thing at which\n\t\t\tthey used to scoff.
Ask them, "Who is there to protect you by night and by day from\n\t\t\tthe wrath of the Compassionate?" Yet they turn away from the\n\t\t\tadmonition of their Rabb.
Do they have such gods who can defend them against Us? Their gods\n\t\t\tcan neither help themselves nor can they protect themselves from\n\t\t\tUs.

The fact is that We gave the good things of this life to them and
			their forefathers until they got used to these things because of
			their prolonged lives; can they not see how We gradually reduce
			the land which was in their control and curtail it from all
			sides? Do they still expect to be victorious against Us?
Tell them, "I am warning you on the authority of Revelation," but\n\t\t\tthe deaf choose not to listen the call when they are warned!
Yet even if a breath from the Wrath of your Rabb was to touch\n\t\t\tthem, they will certainly say, "Woe to us! No doubt we were\n\t\t\twrongdoers."

On the Day of Judgement We shall set up scales of justice so that
			no one will be dealt with unjustly in any way; even if someone
			has an act as small as a grain of a mustard seed, We will bring
			it to account, and sufficient are We to settle the accounts.
Certainly, We granted to Musa (Moses) and Haroon (Aaron) the\n\t\t\tCriterion of right and wrong, a light and a reminder for those\n\t\t\trighteous people
who fear their Rabb though they have not seen Him, and dread the\n\t\t\tDay of Judgment.
And now We have revealed this blessed Reminder (The Qur'an). Will\n\t\t\tyou then deny it?
Even before that We blessed Ibrahim (Abraham) with rectitude, for\n\t\t\tWe knew him well.
Remember that occasion when Ibrahim asked his father and his\n\t\t\tpeople, "What are these images to which you are so devoted?"
They replied, "We found our forefathers worshipping them."
He said "Then certainly both you and your forefathers have been\n\t\t\tin manifest error."
They asked, "Have you brought us the Truth or are you one of the\n\t\t\ttriflers?"
He replied, "Nay! Your Rabb is the Lord of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth. It is He Who has created them; and I am of those who bear\n\t\t\twitness to this.
By Allah! I will certainly plan against your idols when you turn\n\t\t\tand go away."
So he broke them all in pieces, except the biggest of them, so\n\t\t\tthat they might turn to it.
(On their return when they saw the plight of their idols), some\n\t\t\tasked, "Who has done this to our gods? He must surely be a wicked\n\t\t\tperson!"
Others replied, "We heard a youth, called Ibrahim, talking about\n\t\t\tthem."
They said, "Then bring him here before the eyes of the people, so\n\t\t\tthat they may witness how severely he is punished."
When Ibrahim came, they asked, "O Ibrahim, are you the one who\n\t\t\thas done this to our gods?"
He replied, "Surely someone has done it; the chief of them, that\n\t\t\tis! Ask them, if they can speak!"
Thereupon they turned to search their own consciences, and said\n\t\t\tto themselves, "Surely you yourselves are the wrongdoers!"
Confounded as they were, lowering their heads they said, "You\n\t\t\tknow fully well that they cannot speak."
At this Ibrahim said, "Do you then worship these deities, instead\n\t\t\tof Allah, who can neither benefit nor harm you?
Shame on you and on those deities you worship besides Allah! Have\n\t\t\tyou no sense at all?"
They cried, "Burn him alive and avenge your gods, if you want to\n\t\t\ttake any action."
When they threw him in the fire, We commanded, "O fire! Be cool\n\t\t\tand comfortable for Ibrahim."
They sought to harm him, but We made them the big losers.
We delivered him and his nephew Lut (Lot) and directed them to\n\t\t\tthe land which We have blessed for all the people of the world.
We gave him a son Ishaq (Isaac) and then a grandson Ya'qoob\n\t\t\t(Jacob); and We made each of them a righteous man.
We made them leaders who guided other people by Our command and\n\t\t\tWe sent them revelations to do good deeds, establish Salah and\n\t\t\tpay Zakah. To Us Alone did they serve.
To Lut (Lot) We gave wisdom and knowledge, and We delivered him\n\t\t\tfrom the town which practiced abominations - surely its\n\t\t\tinhabitants were very wicked transgressors
- and We admitted him to Our mercy: for he was of the righteous\n\t\t\tpeople.
Before them Nuh (Noah) prayed to Us, We accepted his prayer and\n\t\t\tdelivered him and his family from the great calamity.
We helped him against those people who had denied Our\n\t\t\trevelations; surely they were an evil people, so We drowned them\n\t\t\tall in the Great Flood.

We also bestowed favors upon Dawood (David) and Sulaiman
			(Solomon): when the two were judging a case regarding the field
			into which the sheep of certain people had strayed by night, and
			We were watching them to arrive at judgment,

at that time We gave Sulaiman insight to arrive at the right
			decision, although We had given wisdom and knowledge to both of
			them. We caused the mountains and the birds to celebrate Our
			praises with Dawood; it was We Who made this happen.
We taught him the armor's craft, so that they might protect you\n\t\t\tin your wars: yet are you ever grateful?
We made the raging winds subservient to Sulaiman, pursuing its\n\t\t\tcourse by his command to the land which We had blessed; and We\n\t\t\thave knowledge of everything.
And We had subjected to him many of the shaitans who dived for\n\t\t\thim into the sea and performed other duties besides this; and We\n\t\t\twere the One Who had control over them for him.
Similarly We blessed Ayub, when he prayed to his Rabb saying, "I\n\t\t\tam badly afflicted with disease: but of all those who show mercy\n\t\t\tYou are the most Merciful."

We accepted his prayer and relieved his affliction, and restored\n\t\t\tnot only his family but also as many more with them as a favor\n\t\t\tfrom Us so that it may serve as a reminder to Our worshippers.
Likewise, We blessed Isma`il (Ishmael), Idris and Zul-kifl, for\n\t\t\tall of them practised patience.
We admitted them to Our Mercy, for they were of the righteous\n\t\t\tpeople.

We blessed Zun-nun (Yunus / Jonah), when he departed in anger,
			thinking We would not take him to task for this, but later he
			prayed to Us from the depths of darkness, "There is no god but
			You, glory be to You! Indeed I was the one who committed wrong."
We accepted his prayer and delivered him from distress; thus do\n\t\t\tWe deliver the believers.
We also blessed Zakariya, when he prayed to his Rabb, "O my Rabb!\n\t\t\tDo not let me remain childless even though You are the best of\n\t\t\tinheritors.
We accepted his prayer and gave him Yahya (John), curing his wife\n\t\t\tfor him to bear a child. They were ever quick in emulating good\n\t\t\tdeeds and called on Us with hope, fear, and submission.
And We blessed the woman (Maryam), who guarded her chastity, We\n\t\t\tbreathed into her of Our Spirit and We made her and her son a\n\t\t\tsign for the whole world.
Verily this brotherhood of yours is a single brotherhood and I am\n\t\t\tyour only Rabb, therefore worship Me Alone.
But the people have divided their religion into sects between\n\t\t\tthem- to Us they shall all return.
Whoever shall do good deeds, provided he is a believer, his\n\t\t\tendeavor will not be rejected: We are recording it all for him.
It is not possible that a nation which We have destroyed may rise\n\t\t\tagain.
Until, when Gog and Magog will be let loose and they will swiftly\n\t\t\tswarm from every height,

and the time of fulfillment for the True Promise will draw near,
			then behold! The eyes of the unbelievers will fixedly stare in
			horror: "O woe to us! We were indeed heedless of this warning;
			nay we were wrongdoers."
Surely you (O mushrikin) and your deities that you worship\n\t\t\tbesides Allah shall be the fuel of hell; therein you shall all\n\t\t\tenter.
If those deities would have been true gods, they would not have\n\t\t\tgotten there; but there they shall abide forever.
In there, sobbing will be their lot, and they will not be able to\n\t\t\thear anything else.
Certainly those for whom the good reward from Us has preceded\n\t\t\tthem will be kept far away from it.
They shall not hear even its slightest sound, and they shall\n\t\t\tdwell forever in the midst of whatever their souls desire.
The time of Great Terror (Day of Judgement) will not grieve them,\n\t\t\tand the angels will receive them with greetings: "This is your\n\t\t\tDay that you were promised."
On that Day We shall roll up the heavens like a scroll of\n\t\t\twritings; just as We originated the first creation, so shall We\n\t\t\tproduce it again - that is Our promise, and We will fulfill it.
We wrote this in The Zaboor (Psalms xxxvii, 29) after the\n\t\t\treminder (Torah given to Musa): that as for the land, My\n\t\t\trighteous servants shall inherit it."
Surely in this is great news for those people who worship Us.
O Muhammad, We have not sent you but as a blessing for all the\n\t\t\tworlds.
Tell them: "It has been revealed to me that your God is One God -\n\t\t\twill you then become Muslims?"
If they give no heed, tell them: "I have warned you all alike in\n\t\t\tcomplete fairness; now I do not know whether what you are\n\t\t\tthreatened with is near or far.
It is He Who knows your spoken words and hidden thoughts.
I do not know whether this delay is a trial for you or you are\n\t\t\tbeing given respite for an appointed time."
Finally the Prophet said: "O Rabb! Pass Your Judgment with\n\t\t\tfairness. And O People! Our Rabb is most Compassionate, Whose\n\t\t\thelp we seek against the blasphemies you utter."
O mankind! Have fear of your Rabb; the catastrophic quaking of\n\t\t\tthe Hour of Doom will be terrible indeed.

On that Day you shall see that every nursing mother will forget
			her nursing-babe and every pregnant female will miscarry, and you
			will see people as if they are intoxicated, though they will not
			be drunk: such will be the horror of Allah's chastisement.
Yet there are some among people, who in their ignorance, argue\n\t\t\tabout Allah and follow every rebellious devil,
though they are doomed to seduce whoever takes them as their\n\t\t\tfriends and lead him to the punishment of burning fire.

O mankind! If you doubt that there is life after death remember
			that We first created you from dust, then from a sperm, then from
			a leech- like mass, then from a morsel of flesh, partly formed
			and partly unformed, so that We may manifest to you Our power. We
			cause to remain in the womb whom We wish for an appointed term,
			and then We bring you forth as infants; then We nourish you so
			that you may reach your age of full strength. There are some of
			you who die young and some who live on to their abject old age
			when all that they once knew they know no more. You sometimes see
			the land dry and barren; but no sooner do We pour down rain upon
			it then it begins to stir and swell, putting forth every kind of
			beautiful growth in pairs.
This is because Allah is the Reality: it is He Who gives life to\n\t\t\tthe dead and it is He Who has power over everything,
and this is a proof that the Hour of Doom is sure to come - there\n\t\t\tis no doubt about it; and that Allah will raise up those who are\n\t\t\tin the graves.
Yet there are others among people who wrangle about Allah, though\n\t\t\tthey neither have knowledge nor guidance, nor an enlightening\n\t\t\tBook,

twisting things around in order to lead others astray from the
			Path of Allah - for such persons there is disgrace in this life,
			and on the Day of Judgment we shall make them taste the
			punishment of burning fire,
saying: "This is what you prepared and sent forth with your own\n\t\t\thands." Rest assured that Allah is not unjust to His worshippers.

There are some people who worship Allah standing on the verge of
			faith (half faith and half disbelief). When such a person is
			blessed with good fortune he is content; but if he encounters a
			trial he turns back headlong; thus losing both this world and the
			Hereafter, which is a clear-cut loss.
Then instead of Allah, he starts calling those deities who can\n\t\t\tneither harm nor help him; now that is going too far off in\n\t\t\tdeviation from the Right Way.
He is calling upon those who are more likely to harm than help;\n\t\t\twhat an evil master and what an evil friend he chooses for help!
As for those who believe and do good deeds, Allah will admit them\n\t\t\tto gardens beneath which the rivers flow. Surely Allah does what\n\t\t\tHe wants.

If anyone thinks that Allah will not help His Rasool in this
			world and in the Hereafter, let him stretch out a rope to the sky
			if he can and cut a hole to peep through and see for himself
			whether his device can avert that which irritates him.
Thus have We revealed this The Qur'an in clear verses; and verily\n\t\t\tAllah gives guidance to whom He wants.

Surely as for those who are true believers (the Muslims), the
			Jews, the Sabians, the Christians, the Magians and the ones who
			commit shirk (polytheists) - Allah will judge between them on the
			Day of Resurrection; for Allah is a witness over everything.

Do you not see how all who dwell in the heavens and the earth bow
			down in worship to Allah, including the sun, the moon, the stars,
			the mountains, the trees, the animals, and a large number of
			people, even a large number of those deserving the punishment. He
			who is humbled by Allah has none who can raise him to honor;
			surely Allah does what He pleases.

These are the two adversaries (the believers and disbelievers)
			who dispute with each other about their Rabb: as for the
			disbelievers, garments of Fire will be cut out for them, boiling
			water will be poured over their heads,
which will not only melt their skins but also the inner parts of\n\t\t\ttheir bellies,
and there will be maces of iron to lash them.
Whenever, in their anguish, they try to escape therefrom, they\n\t\t\twill be forced back therein, and will be told: "Taste the\n\t\t\tpunishment of conflagration!"

As for those who have faith and do good deeds, Allah will
			certainly admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow. They
			shall be decked with pearls and bracelets of gold, and their
			garments will be of silk.
This is because during their life on earth, they were guided to\n\t\t\taccept the pure words of Allah and they were shown the Way of the\n\t\t\tAll-Praiseworthy.

As for those who are unbelievers and debar others from the Way of
			Allah and from the Masjid-al-Haram, to which We have assigned all
			mankind with equal rights whether they are natives or foreigners,
			and whoever intend to deviate from righteousness to wrongdoing in
			its vicinity, We will make him taste a painful punishment.

Remember! We identified the site of the Sacred House to Ibrahim
			(Abraham), saying, "Worship none besides Me, sanctify My House
			for those worshippers who make Tawaf (walking counterclockwise
			around it as a part of the Hajj rituals), and stand in prayer,
			bow, and prostrate themselves,
and make a proclamation of Hajj (Pilgrimage) to mankind: they\n\t\t\twill come to you on foot and on lean camels from every distant\n\t\t\tquarter,

so that they may witness the benefits which are made available
			here for them, and pronounce the name of Allah over the cattle
			which We have provided as food for them, on the appointed days,
			then eat meat themselves and feed the indigent and needy.
Then they should accomplish their needful acts of shaving or\n\t\t\tcutting their hair and taking a bath, fulfill their vows and go\n\t\t\tfor Tawaf-e-Ziyarah to the Ancient House.

This was the object for which the Ka'bah was built, and whoever
			honors the sacred rites of Allah, it is good for him in the sight
			of his Rabb. The meat of cattle is lawful to you, except what has
			already been mentioned to you; therefore, shun the abomination of
			idols and shun all false statements.

Dedicate yourselves to Allah and do not commit shirk with Him:
			for anyone who commits shirk, it is as though he had fallen from
			the sky; then his body is either snatched away by birds or
			carried away by the wind to some far-off place,
so it is, and he who respects the Symbols of Allah, surely shows\n\t\t\tthe piety of his heart.
You may benefit (by using their milk) from the cattle dedicated\n\t\t\tfor sacrifice, until the time of their slaughter, then their\n\t\t\tplace of sacrifice is near the Ancient House.

For every nation We prescribed a way of sacrifice so that they
			may pronounce the name of Allah over the cattle which He has
			given them for food, but the object is one and the same: to
			remember that your God is one God; so submit yourselves to Him as
			a Muslim, and O Prophet, give good news to the humble,
whose hearts tremble at the mention of Allah; who endure\n\t\t\tadversity with patience, who establish Salah and spend in charity\n\t\t\tout of what we have given them.

We have included the sacrificial camels among the Symbols of
			Allah, for there is much good for you in them. Therefore,
			pronounce the name of Allah over them while standing, and when
			they fall down on their sides after slaughter, when their
			movement completely stops, then eat of their meat, feed the
			contented (poor who do not ask) and the beggars (poor who ask).
			Thus We have subjected these animals to you so that you may be
			grateful.

It is neither their meat nor their blood that reaches Allah; it
			is your piety that reaches Him. Thus, He has subjected these
			animals to you so that you may glorify Allah for giving you
			guidance, and O Prophet, give good news to those who do good to
			others.
Surely Allah wards off evil from those who are true believers:\n\t\t\tfor certainly Allah does not love anyone who is treacherous,\n\t\t\tungrateful.

Permission to fight back is hereby granted to the believers
			against whom war is waged and because they are oppressed (before
			this revelation, Muslims were not allowed to fight even for self
			defence); certainly Allah has power to grant them victory

- those who have been unjustly expelled from their homes only
			because they said, "Our Lord is Allah." Had not Allah repelled
			some people by the might of others, the monasteries, churches,
			synagogues, and mosques in which Allah's praise is daily
			celebrated, would have been utterly demolished. Allah will
			certainly help those who help His cause; most surely Allah is
			Mighty, Powerful.

These are the people who, if We establish them in the land, will\n\t\t\testablish Salah and pay Zakah, enjoin justice and forbid evil;\n\t\t\tthe final decision of all affairs is in the hands of Allah.
If they deny you O Muhammad, remember that before them the people\n\t\t\tof Nuh (Noah), 'Ad and Thamud;
the people of Ibrahim (Abraham) and Lut (Lot);

as well as the residents of Madyan had denied their Prophets,
			likewise Musa (Moses) was also denied. Initially, I gave respite
			to all those unbelievers and then I seized them: see how terrible
			was My disapproval!
How many townships, teaming with wrong doings, have We utterly\n\t\t\tdestroyed! Today they lie with their roofs fallen in, their wells\n\t\t\tabandoned, and their lofty castles deserted.

Have they not traveled through the land? Have they no hearts to
			learn wisdom, or ears to hear the Truth? Certainly it is not
			their eyes which are blind, but it is the hearts in their breasts
			which are blind.

These people ask you to hasten the threatened punishment. Well,
			Allah will never go back on His promise. In fact a day of your
			Rabb (time period in which Allah's decision is executed) is equal
			to a thousand years of your calculation.
There have been many townships teeming with wrong doings, to whom\n\t\t\tat first I gave respite and at the end I smote them. Towards Me\n\t\t\tis the destination of all.
O Muhammad, tell them: "O mankind! I am merely a plain Warner to\n\t\t\tyou;
Those who accept the true faith and do good deeds shall be\n\t\t\tforgiven and provided honorable sustenance;
but those who strive against Our revelations shall be the inmates\n\t\t\tof flaming fire."

Never have We sent a Rasool or a prophet before you, O Muhammad,
			with whose wishes Shaitan did not tamper; but Allah abrogates the
			interjections of Shaitan and confirms His own revelations, for
			Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

He makes Shaitan's interjections a temptation for those whose
			hearts suffer from the disease of hypocrisy and whose hearts are
			hardened - that's why the wrongdoers are in such an extreme
			dissension

- so that those who are endowed with knowledge may realize that
			this (Qur'an) is the Truth from your Rabb and thus believe in it
			and humble their hearts towards Him, and surely Allah will guide
			the believers to the Straight Way.
As for the unbelievers, they will never cease to doubt the\n\t\t\trevelation, until the Hour of Doom overtakes them suddenly or\n\t\t\tthere comes on them the punishment of the Day of Disaster.
On that Day the Kingdom will be that of Allah's; He will judge\n\t\t\tbetween them; so those who have embraced the true faith and done\n\t\t\tgood deeds shall enter the gardens of delight;
but the unbelievers who have denied Our revelations shall receive\n\t\t\ta disgraceful punishment.
As for those who migrated for the sake of Allah and afterwards\n\t\t\twere killed or died, Allah will make a generous provision for\n\t\t\tthem; certainly Allah is the One Who is the best Provider.
He will admit them to a place with which they shall be well\n\t\t\tpleased; for Allah is All-Knowing, Most Lenient.

Thus shall it be! He that retaliates equal to the infliction he
			received and then is wronged again, will most certainly be helped
			by Allah; surely Allah is the One Who is All-Forbearing, Most
			Forgiving.
That is because it is Allah Who causes the night to pass into the\n\t\t\tday, and the day into the night, Allah is indeed All-Hearing,\n\t\t\tMost Observing.
That is because Allah is the One Who is Real; and all those\n\t\t\tdeities besides Him, whom they invoke, are false; indeed it is\n\t\t\tAllah Who is the Supreme, the Great.
Do you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky so the\n\t\t\tland becomes green? Surely Allah is the Benignant, Aware.
To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth; surely\n\t\t\tAllah is the One Who is the Self-sufficient, the Praiseworthy.

Do you not see that Allah has subdued to you all that is in the
			earth and the ships that sail through the sea by His command? He
			is withholding the sky in a way that it cannot fall down on the
			earth without His permission; surely Allah is very kind and
			merciful to mankind.
He is the One Who has given you life, will cause you to die and\n\t\t\tthen will bring you back to life again - yet man is indeed very\n\t\t\tungrateful.

To every nation We have prescribed the rites of worship which
			they observe, therefore, let them not dispute with you concerning
			this matter - keep calling them to the Way of your Rabb; for most
			surely you are rightly guided.
If they argue with you, say: "Allah knows best all that you do."
Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection\n\t\t\tconcerning the matters in which you differ.
Do you not know that Allah is aware of all that is in heaven and\n\t\t\tthe earth? Certainly all of this is recorded in a Book and it is\n\t\t\tvery easy for Allah to do so.
Yet they worship besides Allah those deities for which He has\n\t\t\trevealed no sanction, nor they themselves have any knowledge\n\t\t\tabout them; certainly the wrongdoers shall have no helper.

When Our revelations are recited to them with all their clarity,
			you can notice a denial on the faces of the unbelievers. They can
			barely restrain themselves from assaulting those who recite Our
			revelations. Say to them: "Shall I tell you something which is
			far worse than that? It is the fire of hell, which Allah has
			promised to those who reject the truth; what an evil abode it
			will be!"

O mankind! Here is an example for your understanding, so listen
			to it carefully. Those deities whom you call besides Allah,
			cannot create a single fly, even if they all combined their
			forces, rather, if a fly snatches away anything from them they
			cannot even get it back; how feebleminded are the suppliants and
			how powerless are those whom they supplicate!
They do not render to Allah the homage due to Him; in fact, Allah\n\t\t\tis the One Who is All-Powerful, All-Mighty.
Allah chooses His messengers from among the angels and from among\n\t\t\tthe human beings, for surely Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and to\n\t\t\tAllah shall all matters return for decision.
O believers! Bow down, prostrate yourselves, worship your Rabb\n\t\t\tand do good deeds so that you may attain salvation.

Strive in the Way of Allah as you ought to strive with sincerity
			and discipline; He has chosen you and has not laid upon you any
			hardship in the observance of your faith - the faith of your
			father Ibrahim (Abraham). He named you Muslims before in prior
			scriptures and in this (The Qur'an), so that His Rasool may
			testify against you and you yourselves may testify against rest
			of the mankind. Therefore, establish Salah, pay Zakah and hold
			fast to Allah; Who is your Protector - so what an excellent
			Protector and what a splendid Supporter!
Indeed successful are those believers
who are humble in their Salah (prayers),
who avoid vain talk,
who are punctual in the payment of Zakah (charity),
who guard their private parts
except with their spouses or those who are legally in their\n\t\t\tpossession, for in that case they shall not be blamed
- however those who seek to go beyond that in lust are the ones\n\t\t\twho shall be the transgressors
- who are true to their trust and covenants,
and who are diligent about their Salah (prayers).
These are the heirs
who will inherit paradise; and live therein forever.
Indeed We have created man from an essence of clay,
then placed him as a drop of semen in a firm resting place,

then changed the semen into a leechlike mass, then leechlike mass
			into a fetus lump, then fetus lump into bones, then clothed the
			bones with flesh, and then We brought him forth as quite a
			different creature from the embryo - so blessed is Allah, the
			best of all creators.
Then after living for a while you shall all die,
then most surely you shall be raised to life again on the Day of\n\t\t\tResurrection.
We have made seven avenues (heavens) above you; and We are never\n\t\t\tunmindful of Our creation.
We send down water from the sky according to a due measure, then\n\t\t\tWe cause it to settle in the soil - you should know that if We\n\t\t\tplease, We can certainly take it away
- then with it We cause to grow gardens of palm trees and grapes\n\t\t\tfor you; yielding abundant fruit for you to eat,
and also a tree which grows on Mount Sinai which produces oil and\n\t\t\trelish as a food for those who like to eat it.
In cattle, too, there is a lesson for you: from within their\n\t\t\tbodies We produce milk for you to drink, besides this you gain\n\t\t\tnumerous other benefits; some of them you eat,
yet on others as well as on ships you ride.
We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people. He said, "O my people! Worship\n\t\t\tAllah, you have no other god but Him, are you not afraid of Him\n\t\t\tfor committing shirk?"

The chiefs of the unbelievers among his people said, "Nuh is but
			a human like you, he desires to assert his superiority over you.
			If Allah wanted to send Rasools, He could have sent down angels,
			we have never heard such a thing as he says from our
			forefathers."
Some of them said: "He is just a madman, so bear with him for a\n\t\t\twhile."
Nuh said, "O my Rabb! Help me against their calling me a liar."

So We revealed Our will to him, saying: "Build an ark under our
			supervision according to Our instructions; and when Our judgement
			comes to pass and water wells out from 'At-Tannur', take aboard a
			pair (a male and a female) from every species and take your
			family, except those of them against whom the judgement has
			already been passed; and do not plead with Me in favor of the
			wrongdoers, for they are doomed to be drowned in the flood.
Then when you have embarked on the ark with your companions, say:\n\t\t\t"Praise be to Allah Who has delivered us from the nation of\n\t\t\twrongdoers,"
and pray, "O my Rabb! Bless my landing from this Ark, for You are\n\t\t\tthe best to make my landing safe."
There are many lessons in this story, and surely We do test\n\t\t\tpeople.
Then We raised after them a new generation (the people of 'Ad),
and sent to them a Rasool (Hud) from among themselves, who said\n\t\t\tto them: "Worship Allah! You have no other god except Him. Will\n\t\t\tyou not fear Him for committing shirk?"

But the chiefs of his people - who disbelieved the message and
			denied the life in the hereafter, - on whom We had bestowed
			affluence in this worldly life, said: "This person is but a human
			like you; he eats of what you eat and drinks of what you drink.
If you obey a human like yourselves, you shall indeed be lost.
What! Does he claim that when you are dead and turned into dust\n\t\t\tand bones, you will be brought to life out of your graves?
Impossible! Just impossible is that with which you are being\n\t\t\tthreatened with!
There is no other life but our life of this world: we live here\n\t\t\tand die here, and shall never be raised to life again.
This man is but an impostor, forging a lie against Allah, and we\n\t\t\tare not going to believe him."
At this the Rasool prayed: "O my Rabb! Help me against their\n\t\t\tcalling me a liar."
Allah responded: "After a short time they will surely be sorry."
So the Blast overtook them in all justice and We swept them away\n\t\t\tlike the rubbish of dead leaves - so gone is the nation of\n\t\t\twrongdoers.
After them We raised other generations
- no people can hasten their term nor can they postpone it

- and sent forth Our Rasools one after another: every time a
			Rasool came to his people, they disbelieved him, so We punished
			them one by one and made them a history; so gone is the nation of
			disbelievers.
Then We sent Musa (Moses) and his brother Haroon (Aaron) with Our\n\t\t\tsigns and clear authority,
to Fir'on (Pharaoh) and his chiefs: but they received them with\n\t\t\tarrogance for they were very haughty people.
They said: "What! Should we believe in two human beings like\n\t\t\tourselves, and whose people are our slaves?"
So they disbelieved both of them and became among those who were\n\t\t\tdestroyed.
And We gave Musa the Book, so that his people might be rightly\n\t\t\tguided.
And We made the son of Maryam (Jesus) and his mother a sign for\n\t\t\tmankind, and gave them a shelter on a peaceful lofty ground,\n\t\t\tfurnished with a fresh spring.
O Rasools! Eat of pure things and do good deeds, certainly I have\n\t\t\tknowledge of all your actions.
In fact, your religion is one religion, and I am your only Rabb:\n\t\t\tso fear Me Alone.
Yet people have divided themselves into factions and each faction\n\t\t\trejoices in its own doctrines
- well! Leave them in their heedlessness for an appointed time.
Do they think that, in giving them wealth and children,
We are eager for their welfare? By no means! They do not\n\t\t\tunderstand the reality of the matter.
Surely those who live cautiously for fear of their Rabb,
who believe in the revelations of their Rabb;
who do not commit shirk with their Rabb,
who give to charity whatever they can give, and their hearts are\n\t\t\tfull of fear by the very idea that they shall have to return to\n\t\t\ttheir Rabb,
it is they who rush in doing good deeds and try to be the first\n\t\t\tin attaining them.
We charge no soul with more than it can bear; We have a Book of\n\t\t\trecord which shall clearly tell the truth, and they shall not be\n\t\t\ttreated unjustly.
But their hearts are blind to all this; and their deeds are also\n\t\t\tdifferent from the believers. They will continue doing their\n\t\t\tmisdeeds
until when We seize those of them who live in comfort with\n\t\t\tpunishment; lo! Then they start crying for help in supplication.
We shall say: "Do not cry for help this Day, for surely from Us\n\t\t\tyou shall receive no help.
My revelations were recited to you, but you used to turn back on\n\t\t\tyour heels
in arrogance, talking nonsense about The Qur'an like one telling\n\t\t\tfables by night.
Do they not ponder over the Word of Allah or has anything new\n\t\t\tcome to them which did not come to their forefathers?
Or is it because they do not recognize their Rasool, who is a\n\t\t\tmember of their own community, that they deny him?
Or are they really convinced that he is a madman? Nay! In fact he\n\t\t\thas brought them the Truth and most of them dislike the Truth.

- Had the Truth followed their appetites, the heavens, the earth
			and everything therein would have been disrupted. Nay! We have
			given them their reminder, but they are heedless to their
			reminder.
Or is it that you are asking them for some recompense? But the\n\t\t\trecompense of your Rabb is the best, for He is the best provider\n\t\t\tof sustenance.
As a matter of fact, you (O Muhammad) are calling them to the\n\t\t\tStraight Way;
and surely those who do not believe in the hereafter will ever\n\t\t\tstray from the Straight Way.
If We show them mercy and relieve them of their affliction, they\n\t\t\twould obstinately persist in their rebellion, blindly wandering\n\t\t\tto and fro;
for even now, when We have inflicted punishment on them, they\n\t\t\thave neither submitted to their Rabb nor humbled themselves\n\t\t\ttowards Him.
Until when We open upon them a gate of severe punishment, you\n\t\t\twill see that they are plunged in utter despair.
It is Allah Who has given you ears, eyes and hearts - yet seldom\n\t\t\tyou show gratitude
- it is He Who has placed you in the earth and before Him you\n\t\t\tshall all be assembled on the Day of Judgement.
It is He Who gives life and cause you to die, and in His control\n\t\t\tis the alternation of the night and the day: then why don't you\n\t\t\tunderstand?
On the contrary they just say what their forefathers said before\n\t\t\tthem,
who said: "What! After death when our bodies become dust and\n\t\t\tbones, could we really be raised to life again?
We have heard many such threats and so did our forefathers before\n\t\t\tus. These are nothing but legends of primitive people."
Say: "To whom belong the earth and everything therein? Tell me if\n\t\t\tyou know?"
They will promptly reply: "to Allah!" Ask them: "Then why you\n\t\t\tdon't use your common sense and believe in Him?"
Say: "Who is the Rabb of the seven heavens and the Rabb of the\n\t\t\tGlorious Throne?"
Right away they will say: "Allah." Ask them: "Then why you don't\n\t\t\tfear Him?"
Say: "In whose hands is the sovereignty of all things, protecting\n\t\t\tall, while against Him there is no protection? Tell me if you\n\t\t\tknow."
Quickly they will reply: "Allah." Ask them: "Then how you can be\n\t\t\tso bewitched?"
The fact of the matter is that We have brought them the Truth,\n\t\t\tand undoubtedly these people are liars.

Never has Allah begotten a son, nor is there any god besides Him.
			Had it been so, each god would govern his own creation, and each
			would have tried to overpower the others. Exalted be Allah, above
			the sort of things they attribute to Him!
He knows what is hidden and what is open: far above is He from\n\t\t\tthe shirk of these people.
Pray: "O my Rabb! If You inflict that punishment with which they\n\t\t\tare being threatened in my lifetime,
then O Rabb, do not include me amongst these unjust people."
Surely We have the power to let you see the punishment with which\n\t\t\tthey are being threatened.
Repel evil with good - We are fully aware of their slanders
- and say, "O my Rabb! I seek refuge in You from the prompting of\n\t\t\tthe shaitans,
and O Rabb! I seek refuge in You even from their coming near me."
These people will never refrain from wrongdoing until when death\n\t\t\tcomes to anyone of them, he will say: "O Rabb! Send me back,

so that I may do good deeds in the world that I have left
			behind." Never! This is just a statement which carries no value,
			it will be too late because there will be a barrier between them
			and the world they have just left till the Day they are raised to
			life again.
On the Day when the Trumpet will be blown, they will neither have\n\t\t\tworldly relations between them any more, nor will they ask about\n\t\t\teach other.
Then only those whose weight of good deeds is heavy, will attain\n\t\t\tsalvation.
As for those whose weight of good deeds is light, they will be\n\t\t\tthe ones who have lost their souls to live in hell forever.
The Fire will burn their faces and they will grin therein with\n\t\t\ttheir lips displaced.
We shall say to them: "Were My revelations not recited to you,\n\t\t\tand did you not deny them?"
They will say: "O our Rabb! Our misfortune overwhelmed us and we\n\t\t\tbecame erring folk.
Our Rabb! Get us out of here; if we ever return to sin, then we\n\t\t\tshall indeed be wrongdoers."
In answer to this Allah will say: "Stay here in shame and do not\n\t\t\tplead with Me!

For you are the same people, who used to make fun of some of My
			worshippers who prayed: 'Our Rabb, We believe in You; please
			forgive us and have mercy on us, for You are the Best of those
			who show mercy!'
But you ridiculed them so much, that you even forgot My very\n\t\t\texistence, and went on laughing at them.
Today I have rewarded them for their fortitude, and they are the\n\t\t\tones who have achieved bliss."
They will be asked: "How many years did you live on earth?"
They will reply: "We lived there a day or part of a day; You may\n\t\t\task those who kept the count."
It will be said: "Well, now you know that your stay was just a\n\t\t\tlittle while - what a pity, you did not believe it then!"
Did you think that We had created you without any purpose and\n\t\t\tthat you would never return to Us for accountability?"
Therefore, exalted be Allah, the Real King; there is no god but\n\t\t\tHim, the Lord of the Honorable Throne.
Whoever invokes another god besides Allah - about whose divinity\n\t\t\the has no proof -he will have to give an account to his Rabb.\n\t\t\tSurely such unbelievers will never attain salvation.
Say: "O Rabb, forgive, have Mercy, You are the Best of those who\n\t\t\tshow mercy!"
This is a Surah which We have revealed and made obligatory; its\n\t\t\trevelations contain clear verses, so that you may take heed.

As for the fornicatoress and the fornicator (a female and a male
			guilty of rape), flog each female and a male guilty of rape one
			hundred lashes and do not take pity in enforcing the law ordained
			by Allah, if you believe in Allah and the Last Day, and let a
			party of the believers witness their punishment.

The fornicator shall not marry any but a fornicatoress or a
			mushrik, and likewise to a fornicatoress, none shall marry her
			but a fornicator or a mushrik: such marriages are forbidden to
			the believers.

Those who accuse a chaste woman of fornication and do not produce
			four witnesses to support their allegation, shall be flogged with
			eighty lashes and their testimony shall not be accepted ever
			after, for they are the ones who are wicked transgressors
- except those who repent thereafter and mend their conduct; for\n\t\t\tAllah is surely Forgiving, Merciful.
Those men who accuse their own wives but have no witness except\n\t\t\tthemselves, each one of them shall be made to swear four times by\n\t\t\tAllah that his charge is true,
and the fifth time calling down upon himself the curse of Allah\n\t\t\tif he is lying.
As for the wife, the punishment shall be averted from her if she\n\t\t\tswears four times by Allah that his (her husband's) charge is\n\t\t\tfalse
and the fifth time calls down the wrath of Allah on herself if\n\t\t\this charge is true.
If it were not for Allah's grace and mercy upon you, you would\n\t\t\thave no method of handling these situations. Allah is the\n\t\t\tAcceptor of Repentance, All-Wise.

Those who concocted the slander are from a clique among you. Do
			not regard this incident as only an evil, for it also contains a
			good lesson for you. Whoever took any part in this sin, has
			earned his share accordingly, and the one who took on himself the
			leading part, shall have a terrible punishment.
Why did not the believing men and believing women, when they\n\t\t\theard of this slander, think well of their own people, and say:\n\t\t\t"This is clearly a false accusation?"
Why did they not produce four witnesses? If they cannot produce\n\t\t\tthe required witnesses, they are the liars in the sight of Allah.
Were it not for the grace and mercy of Allah towards you in this\n\t\t\tworld and the Hereafter, you would have been severely punished\n\t\t\tfor your involvement in this scandal;
when you passed on with your tongues and uttered with your mouths\n\t\t\tthat about which you had no knowledge. You took it lightly while\n\t\t\tit was a very serious offence in the sight of Allah.
Why did you not, when you heard about it, say: "It is not\n\t\t\tbefitting for us to talk about it, God forbid! This is a\n\t\t\tmonstrous slander?"
