Allah admonishes you never to repeat a mistake like this, if you\n\t\t\tare true believers.
Allah has made His revelations clear to you, Allah is\n\t\t\tAll-Knowing, All-Wise.
Those who love to broadcast such slanders among the believers\n\t\t\twill have a painful punishment in this life and in the Hereafter.\n\t\t\tAllah knows and you do not know.
Were it not for the grace and mercy of Allah towards you, this\n\t\t\tscandal would have produced very bad results for you. Allah is\n\t\t\tindeed very Kind, most Merciful.

O believers! Do not follow the footsteps of Shaitan: because
			anyone who follows the footsteps of Shaitan is seduced by him to
			commit acts of indecency and wickedness. If there had not been
			the grace and mercy of Allah upon you, none of you would have
			ever been purified from that sin, for it is Allah Alone Who
			purifies whom He pleases, and Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

Let not those among you who are endowed with grace and amplitude
			of means swear to withhold their help from their relatives, the
			indigent and those who left their homes for the cause of Allah -
			rather let them forgive and overlook - do you not wish that Allah
			should forgive you? Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
Those who accuse chaste but careless believing women are cursed\n\t\t\tin this life, and in the Hereafter they shall have a grievous\n\t\t\tpunishment.
Such people should not forget that Day when their own tongues,\n\t\t\ttheir own hands and their own feet will testify against their\n\t\t\tmisdeeds.
On that Day, Allah will give them the full reward they deserve,\n\t\t\tthen they will realize that Allah is the One Who manifests the\n\t\t\tTruth.

Unclean women are for unclean men, and unclean men are for
			unclean women; and pure women are for pure men, and pure men are
			for pure women. They are free from the slanderer's accusations;
			for them there shall be forgiveness and honorable provision from
			Allah.
O believers! Do not enter houses other than your own until you\n\t\t\thave sought permission and said greetings of peace to the\n\t\t\toccupants; this is better for you, so that you may be mindful.

If you do not find the person you wanted to see, then do not
			enter until permission is given to you; and if you are asked to
			go back, then go back; this is more fitting for you; and Allah is
			cognizant of what you do.
There is no blame on you if you enter houses which are not used\n\t\t\tfor dwelling and in which you have something belonging to you;\n\t\t\tand Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
Enjoin the believing men to lower their gaze and guard their\n\t\t\tmodesty; that is chaster for them. Surely Allah is well aware of\n\t\t\ttheir actions.

Likewise enjoin the believing women to lower their gaze and guard
			their modesty; not to display their beauty and ornaments except
			what normally appears thereof; let them draw their veils over
			their bosoms and not display their charms except to their
			husbands, their fathers, their fathers-in-law, their own sons,
			their stepsons, their own brothers, their nephews on either
			brothers' or sisters' sides, their own womenfolk, their own
			slaves, male attendants who lack sexual desires or small children
			who have no carnal knowledge of women. Also enjoin them not to
			strike their feet in order to draw attention to their hidden
			trinkets. And O believers! Turn to Allah in repentance, all of
			you, about your past mistakes, so that you may attain salvation.

Get the singles among you married as well as those who are fit
			for marriage among your male slaves and female slaves. If they
			are poor, Allah will make them free from want out of His grace:
			for Allah has boundless resources and is All-Knowing.

And let those who do not find means to marry keep themselves
			chaste until Allah enriches them out of His bounty. As for those
			of your slaves who wish to buy out their liberty, execute the
			deed of liberty with them if you find them deserving, and give
			them some of the wealth which Allah has given you. Do not force
			your slave-girls into prostitution for your own worldly gains, if
			they wish to preserve their chastity; and if anyone forces them
			into it, then surely after such a compulsion Allah will be
			forgiving and merciful to them.

We have already sent down to you revelations giving you clear
			guidance and cited examples of those people who passed away
			before you to serve as a warning and an admonition for the
			righteous people.

Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The parable of
			His Light is as if there were a Niche, in which there is a lamp,
			the lamp is enclosed in crystal, the crystal is of a starlike
			brilliance, it is lit with the olive oil from a blessed olive
			tree which is neither eastern nor western, its very oil would
			almost be luminous though no fire touched it - as though all the
			means of increasing Light upon Light are provided - Allah guides
			to His Light whom He pleases. Allah cites such parables to make
			His message clear to the people; and Allah has knowledge of
			everything.
His Light is found in those houses which Allah has sanctioned to\n\t\t\tbe built for the remembrance of His name; where His praise is\n\t\t\tsung, in the mornings and in the evenings again and again,

by such people whom neither business nor business profit can
			divert from the remembrance of Allah, nor from establishing Salah
			and nor from paying Zakah, for they fear the Day of Judgement
			when hearts will be overturned and eyes will be petrified,
who hope that Allah will reward them according to the best of\n\t\t\ttheir deeds and add for them even more out of His grace: for\n\t\t\tAllah gives without measure to whom He pleases.

As for the unbelievers, their deeds will disappear like a mirage
			in a sandy desert, which the thirsty traveller thinks to be
			water, but when he comes near, he finds it to be nothing, instead
			he finds Allah to settle his account - Allah is swift in settling
			accounts.

Or another parable of unbelievers' efforts is that of person
			trying to swim in a bottomless ocean overwhelmed with billows,
			one over the other, overcast with dark clouds - layers of utter
			darkness one above another - so much so that if he stretches out
			his hand, he can hardly see it. The one to whom Allah does not
			give light, will have no light!

Do you not see that Allah is the One Who is praised by all those
			who are in the heavens and in the earth? The very birds praise
			Him as they wing their flight. Each one knows its prayers and how
			to praise Him, and Allah has full knowledge of all their actions.
To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth; and\n\t\t\ttowards Allah lies the final goal.

Do you not see that Allah makes the clouds move gently, then
			joins them together, then piles them up in masses, then you see
			the rain coming from inside them? He also sends down hail from
			the clouds that look like mountains in the sky, afflicting
			therewith whom He wills and turning it away from whom He pleases;
			the flash of His lightning almost takes away sight.
Allah alternates the night and the day; there is indeed a lesson\n\t\t\tin it for those who possess insight.

Allah has created from water every living creature: of them there
			are some that creep upon their bellies, some that walk on two
			legs, and yet some that walk on four; Allah creates what He
			pleases; surely Allah has power over everything.
We have indeed sent down revelations demonstrating the Truth, and\n\t\t\tAllah guides to the Straight Way whom He pleases.
They say: "We believe in Allah and the Rasool and we obey," but\n\t\t\tno sooner do they utter these words than some of them turn their\n\t\t\tbacks; these are no believers.
When such people are called to Allah and His Rasool that He may\n\t\t\tjudge between them, behold! A party of them decline to come.
However, if they have the truth on their side, they come to him\n\t\t\tvoluntarily.
Is there a disease in their hearts? Either they are skeptical, or\n\t\t\telse they fear that Allah and His Rasool will deny them justice.\n\t\t\tNay! In fact they are the ones who are the wrongdoers.

The response of the true believers, when they are called to Allah
			and His Rasool that he may judge between them, is only to say:
			"We hear and we obey." Such are the ones who will attain
			felicity.
Only those who obey Allah and His Rasool, have fear of Allah and\n\t\t\tdo good deeds, are the ones who will be the winners.

They solemnly swear by Allah that if you command them, they will
			go forth leaving their homes. O Muhammad tell them: "Do not
			swear; your obedience not your oaths will count; surely Allah is
			fully aware of what you do."

Say: "Obey Allah and obey the Rasool. If you do not, the Rasool
			is still under obligation to fulfill his duty, as you are under
			obligation to fulfill yours; and if you obey him, you shall be
			rightly guided. Note it well that the responsibility of the
			Rasool is only to deliver Allah's message clearly."

Allah has promised those of you who believe and do good deeds
			that He will most surely make them vicegerent in the earth as He
			made their ancestors before them, and that He will establish for
			them their religion, the one which He has chosen for them, and
			that He will change their present state of fear into peace and
			security. Let them worship Me Alone and not to commit shirk with
			Me; and if anyone rejects faith after this, it is they who are
			the transgressors.
Therefore establish Salah, pay Zakah and obey the Rasool, so that\n\t\t\tyou may be shown mercy.
Never think that the unbelievers can frustrate anything in the\n\t\t\tland. As for them, the fire shall be their home, and that is an\n\t\t\tevil abode.

O believers! Let your servants and those children who have not
			yet attained puberty ask your permission before coming in to see
			you on three occasions: before Fajr Salah (dawn prayer), at noon
			when you put off your clothes, and after the Isha Salah (night
			prayer). These are your three times of privacy. At other times,
			there is no blame on you if you, or they, go around visiting one
			another. Thus Allah makes His revelations clear to you, for Allah
			is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

And when your children reach the age of puberty, let them still\n\t\t\task your permission as their elders do. Thus Allah makes His\n\t\t\trevelations clear to you, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

There is no blame on such elderly women who have no interest in
			getting married, if they lay aside their cloaks without
			displaying their adornment, but it is better for them if they do
			not discard. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

There is no blame on the blind, nor there is blame on the lame,
			nor there is blame on the sick, to eat at your table. Nor shall
			it be an offence for you to eat in the houses of your own
			children, or your fathers, or your mothers, or your brothers, or
			your sisters, or your paternal uncles, or your paternal aunts, or
			your maternal uncles, or your maternal aunts, or your sincere
			friends, or in houses with the keys of which you are entrusted.
			There is no blame on you whether you eat together or apart;
			however, when you enter the houses, you should greet one another
			with the greeting of peace prescribed by Allah blessed and pure.
			Thus Allah makes His revelations clear to you, so that you may
			grow in understanding.

The true believers are only those who believe in Allah and His
			Rasool, and who, when gathered with him on a matter requiring
			collective action, do not depart until they have obtained his
			permission - only those who ask your permission are the ones who
			truly believe in Allah and His Rasool - so when they ask your
			permission to leave and attend to theirs private business, you
			may give permission to those of them whom you deem appropriate
			and implore Allah to forgive them; surely Allah is Forgiving,
			Merciful.

Do not consider the summoning of the Rasool in the same manner,
			as you consider the summoning of one another among yourselves.
			Allah knows those of you who slip away, concealing themselves
			behind others. Let those who disobey his orders beware, lest some
			trial befall them or a painful punishment be inflicted on them.

Beware! Whatever is in the heavens and in the earth belongs to
			Allah. He knows what you are up to. The Day on which they will be
			brought back to Him, He will tell them all that they have done.
			Allah has the knowledge of everything.
Blessed is the One Who has revealed Al-Furqan (the criterion to\n\t\t\tdistinguish right from wrong: The Qur'an) to His servant, that he\n\t\t\tmay be a Warner to the worlds;

He is the One to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth, has begotten no son and has no partner in His kingdom; He\n\t\t\thas created everything and ordained them in due proportions.

Yet the unbelievers have taken besides Him other gods which can
			create nothing but are themselves created, which can neither harm
			nor help even themselves, and which have no power over life or
			death, or raising the dead to life.

Those who deny the Truth say: "This Al-Furqan (The Qur'an) is but
			a forgery which he (Muhammad) himself has devised and some other
			people have helped him." Unjust is what they do and falsehood is
			what they utter!
And they say: "These are the stories of the ancients which he has\n\t\t\tcopied down from what is read to him day and night."
Tell them: "This (The Qur'an) is revealed by Him Who knows the\n\t\t\tsecrets of the heavens and the earth; surely He is\n\t\t\tEver-Forgiving, Merciful."
And they say: "What sort of Rasool is he who eats food and walks\n\t\t\tthrough the streets? Why has no angel been sent down with him to\n\t\t\tthreaten the disbelievers?
Why he has not been given a treasure or at least a garden from\n\t\t\twhich he could eat?" And these wicked people further say: "You\n\t\t\tare only following a man who is bewitched."
See what sort of examples they apply to you! Because they are\n\t\t\tlost and cannot find the way to refute the truth of Tawhid and\n\t\t\tlife after death.
Blessed is He, Who, if He wills, could give you much better\n\t\t\tthings than what they propose for you: not one but many gardens\n\t\t\tbeneath which rivers flow; and make for you palaces too.
But in fact they deny the Hour - and for the one who denies the\n\t\t\tcoming of the Hour, We have prepared a blazing fire.
When it shall come into their sight, from a long distance, they\n\t\t\twill hear its raging and roaring.
And when, chained together, they are flung into some narrow\n\t\t\tspace, they will fervently plead for death.
But they will be told: "Do not plead for one death today, but\n\t\t\tplead for many deaths."
Ask them: "Which is better, this hell or the eternal paradise\n\t\t\twhich the righteous are being promised, which will be the reward\n\t\t\tof their good deeds and also their final destination;
wherein they will live forever and get everything that they wish\n\t\t\tfor: and this is the promise worth praying for, which your Rabb\n\t\t\tis going to fulfill."

On that Day, He will gather all these people together along with
			the deities whom they worshiped besides Allah, and ask: "Was it
			you who misled these servants of Mine, or did they choose to go
			astray themselves?"

Those deities will answer: "Glory be to You! It was not befitting
			for us that we could take any guardian besides You, but You let
			them and their forefathers enjoy the comforts of worldly life
			until they forgot the Reminder, and thereby became worthless
			people."

Thus your gods will deny all that you profess today. Then you
			shall neither be able to avert your punishment nor shall you get
			any help from anywhere; and every one among you who is guilty of
			wrongdoing, We shall make him taste the mighty punishment.

We have sent no Rasool before you, who did not eat or walk
			through the streets. In fact, We test you by means of one
			another. Now, will you show patience, for your Rabb is Ever
			Observant.

Those who do not expect to meet Us on the Day of Judgement say:
			"Why are not the angels sent down to us or why do we not see our
			Rabb?" Certainly they are too proud of themselves, and have
			revolted in a great revolt.
On the Day when they see the angels, it will not be a Day of\n\t\t\trejoicing for the criminal; rather they will cry: "May there be a\n\t\t\tstone barrier between us and the angels of punishment."
Then We shall turn to the deeds which they did, based on their\n\t\t\twrong opinions, and render them vain like blown dust.
In contrast, the heirs of paradise shall have the best residence\n\t\t\tand finest lodging on that Day.
On that Day when the heavens shall burst asunder with clouds and\n\t\t\tthe angels will be sent down ranks after ranks,
the real Kingdom on that Day will belong only to the\n\t\t\tCompassionate (Allah), a hard Day shall it be for the\n\t\t\tunbelievers.
On that Day the wrongdoer will bite his hands saying: "Oh! Would\n\t\t\tthat I had only taken the pathway alongside the Rasool!
Oh! Would that I had never chosen so-and-so for my companion.
He was the one who led me astray from the admonition even after\n\t\t\tit had reached me." Shaitan is ever treacherous to man.
The Rasool will say: "O my Rabb! Surely my people took this\n\t\t\tQur'an for foolish nonsense."
That is how We made for every Rasool an enemy among the\n\t\t\tcriminals, but your Rabb is sufficient for you (O Muhammad) as a\n\t\t\tGuide and Helper.
The unbelievers ask: "Why is not the Qur'an revealed to him all\n\t\t\tin a single revelation?" This method of slow, well arranged,\n\t\t\tpiecemeal revelations is adopted to strengthen your heart.
The other reason for this method is that any time they come to\n\t\t\tyou with an argument, We reveal to you the Truth and properly\n\t\t\texplain it.
Those who will be dragged headlong into hell shall have an evil\n\t\t\tplace to dwell in, for they had lost the Way by taking an utterly\n\t\t\twrong stand.
We gave Musa (Moses) the Book and appointed his brother Haroon\n\t\t\t(Aaron) as a deputy with him,
and said to them: "Both of you should go to the people who have\n\t\t\tdenied Our Revelations." But those people rejected Our Rasools,\n\t\t\tas a result We destroyed them with utter destruction.
Likewise, the people of Nuh (Noah) We drowned when they rejected\n\t\t\tthe Rasools and made them an example for mankind; and We have\n\t\t\tprepared a painful punishment for such wrongdoers.
The nations of `Ad and Thamud were also destroyed, and so were\n\t\t\tthe dwellers of Ar-Rass, and many generations between them.
We admonished each of them by citing examples of those who were\n\t\t\tdestroyed before them, even then they rejected Our revelations,\n\t\t\tso We exterminated each one of them.

These unbelievers must have passed by that town which was\n\t\t\tdestroyed by a fatal rain; had they not seen its ruins? But the\n\t\t\tfact of the matter is they do not believe in the life hereafter.
Whenever they see you, they scoff at you, saying: "Is this the\n\t\t\tman whom Allah has sent as a Rasool?
Had we not stood firm, he (Muhammad) would have turned us away\n\t\t\tfrom our gods." Very soon, when they face the punishment, they\n\t\t\twill realize who actually went off the Right Path.
Have you ever seen the one who has taken his own desires as his\n\t\t\tgod? Would you take the responsibility of guiding him?
Or do you think that most of them listen or try to understand?\n\t\t\tThey are nothing but animals - nay, they are even further off\n\t\t\ttrack!
Have you not seen how your Rabb extends a shadow? If He wanted,\n\t\t\tHe could make it constant. Then We made the sun an indication of\n\t\t\tit;
as the sun climbs up, We draw it in little by little towards\n\t\t\tOurselves.
He is the One Who has made the night a mantle for you, and sleep\n\t\t\ta rest, and made the day to rise up again.
He is the One Who sends the winds as heralds announcing His Mercy\n\t\t\tand sends down pure water from the sky,
so that with it We may give life to a dead land, and quench the\n\t\t\tthirst of countless animals and men that We have created.
We distribute this water among them so that they may glorify Us,\n\t\t\tyet most people refuse to do anything except show ingratitude.
Had it been Our Will, We could have sent a Warner to every town,
therefore, do not yield to the unbelievers, and make Jihad\n\t\t\t(strive) against them with this Qur'an, a mighty Jihad (strenuous\n\t\t\tstriving).
He is the One Who has made the two seas rolling, the one sweet\n\t\t\tand fresh, the other salt and bitter, and set a rampart between\n\t\t\tthem, an insurmountable barrier.
He is the One Who has created man from water, then made for him\n\t\t\tblood relationships and that of marriage relationships, your Rabb\n\t\t\tis indeed All-Powerful.
Yet they worship those deities besides Allah which can neither\n\t\t\thelp nor harm them, over and above this, the unbeliever has\n\t\t\tbecome a helper of every rebel against his own Rabb.
But O Muhammad! We have sent you only to proclaim good news and\n\t\t\tto give warning.
Say: "I ask of you no recompense for this work except that he who\n\t\t\twants, may take a the Right Way to his Rabb."
Put your trust in the Ever-Living (Allah) Who never dies:\n\t\t\tcelebrate His praise, for He Alone is sufficient to be aware of\n\t\t\tthe sins of His servants.

The One Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is
			between them in six days, and is firmly established on the Throne
			of authority; the Compassionate (Allah): as to His Glory, ask the
			one who knows.

When it is said to them, "Prostrate yourselves before the Most
			Compassionate," they ask: "Who is that Most Compassionate? Are we
			to prostrate just because you order us to?" It merely increase
			their disdain.
Blessed is the One Who has decked the sky with constellations and\n\t\t\tplaced in it a lamp and a shining moon.
He is the One Who has caused the night and the day to succeed\n\t\t\teach other, for him who desires to learn a lesson or desires to\n\t\t\trender thanks.
True servants of the Compassionate (Allah) are those who walk on\n\t\t\tthe earth in humility and when the ignorant people address them,\n\t\t\tthey say: "Peace;"
who pass the night prostrating before their Rabb and standing in\n\t\t\tprayers;
who say: "Our Rabb! Ward off the punishment of hell from us, for\n\t\t\tits punishment is atrocious
- certainly it is an evil abode and an evil resting place;"
who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor stingy, but\n\t\t\tkeep the balance between those two extremes;

who do not invoke any other god besides Allah, nor kill any soul\n\t\t\twhich Allah has made sacred, except for a just cause, nor commit\n\t\t\tfornication - he that does this shall be punished for his sin,
and his punishment shall be doubled on the Day of Resurrection\n\t\t\tand in disgrace he shall abide forever,
except the one who repents, becomes a true believer, and starts\n\t\t\tdoing good deeds, for then Allah will change his evil deeds into\n\t\t\tgood, and Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
He that repents and does good deeds, has truly turned to Allah\n\t\t\twith good turning.
Those are the ones who do not bear witness to falsehood and, if\n\t\t\tthey ever pass by futility, pass with dignity.
Who, when reminded about the revelations of their Rabb, do not\n\t\t\tturn a blind eye and a deaf ear to them.
Who pray: "Our Rabb! Make our wives and our children to be the\n\t\t\tcomfort of our eyes, and make us leaders of the righteous."
Such are the ones who will be rewarded with the lofty places in\n\t\t\tparadise for their patience, wherein they shall be welcomed with\n\t\t\tgreetings and salutations.
They shall live forever in that excellent dwelling and excellent\n\t\t\tresting place!
O Muhammad! Say: "My Rabb does not care at all if you invoke Him\n\t\t\tor not. Now that you have rejected His revelations, soon you will\n\t\t\tface the inevitable punishment."
Tua Sin M'im.
These are verses of the Glorious Book.
O Muhammad, you will perhaps fret yourself to death with grief\n\t\t\tbecause they do not believe.
If We wanted, We could send down upon them a sign from the heaven\n\t\t\tbefore which they would bend their necks in submission, but that\n\t\t\tis not what We want.
They have been turning their backs on each fresh warning that\n\t\t\tcomes to them from the Compassionate (Allah).
But now that they have neglected the warning, they will soon come\n\t\t\tto know the reality of what they have been mocking at.
Have they not looked at the earth to see how We have caused all\n\t\t\tkinds of noble pairs to grow in it?
Surely in this there is a sign; yet most of them do not believe.
In fact your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
Remind them of the story when your Rabb called Musa (Moses) and\n\t\t\tsaid: "Go to the wicked people
the people of Fir'on (Pharaoh). Have they no fear?"
Musa submitted, saying: "My Rabb! I fear that they will reject\n\t\t\tme.
My breast feels cramped and my tongue is not eloquent; send\n\t\t\tHaroon (Aaron).
They have a charge of manslaughter against me and I fear they may\n\t\t\tput me to death."
Allah said: "Indeed not! Proceed, both of you, with Our signs;\n\t\t\tsurely We are with you, listening.
Go to Fir'on and tell him: "We are the Rasools from the Rabb of\n\t\t\tthe Worlds.
You should send with us the Children of Israel."
When they went to Fir'on and conveyed the Message of Allah, he\n\t\t\tsaid: "Did we not cherish you when you were a child? Did you not\n\t\t\tstay several years of your life among us?
Then you did what you did; you are so ungrateful!"
Musa replied: "I did that when I was a misguided youth.
I fled from you all because I feared you; but now my Rabb has\n\t\t\tgranted me wisdom and appointed me as one of His Rasools.
Is it a favor with which you taunt me, that you have enslaved the\n\t\t\tChildren of Israel?"
Fir'on said: "Who is this Rabb of the Worlds?"
Musa replied: "He is the Rabb of the heavens and the earth and\n\t\t\tall that lies between them, if you really care to believe".
Fir'on said to those around him, "Do you hear that?"
Musa continued: "He is your Rabb and the Rabb of your\n\t\t\tforefathers."
Fir'on interjected: "This Rasool of yours, who has been sent to\n\t\t\tyou, is crazy".
Musa continued:" He is the Rabb of the east and west, and all\n\t\t\tthat lies between them. If you would only care and try to\n\t\t\tunderstand."
At this, Fir'on, who did not want to listen any more said: "If\n\t\t\tyou serve any other god besides me, I shall have you thrown into\n\t\t\tprison."
At this, Musa said: "What if I show you a convincing sign?"
Fir'on said: "Go ahead, show it if you are of the truthful."
Hearing this, Musa threw down his staff, and thereupon it changed\n\t\t\tinto veritable serpent.
Then he drew forth his hand and it became shining bright for the\n\t\t\tspectators.
After witnessing both the miracles, Fir'on (Pharaoh) said to the\n\t\t\tchiefs around him: "This fellow is certainly a skilled magician,
who seeks to drive you out from your land by the force of his\n\t\t\tmagic. Now what is your advice?"
They submitted: "Put him and his brother off for a while, and\n\t\t\tdispatch heralds to the various cities
to bring you every skilled magician."
So the magicians were brought together at the appointment time on\n\t\t\ta fixed day.
The people were motivated through saying: "Would you come to the\n\t\t\tgathering?
So that we may follow the magicians if they are dominant".
When the magicians arrived, they asked Fir'on: "Shall we get a\n\t\t\treward if we are dominant?"
Fir'on replied: "Yes of course! You will even be made my\n\t\t\tcourtiers."
Musa said to them: "Cast down what you are going to cast."
Thereupon they cast down their ropes and staffs, saying: "By the\n\t\t\tglory of Fir'on, we shall be the winners."
Then Musa threw down his staff, and lo! It swallowed their false\n\t\t\tdevices.
At this, all the magicians prostrated themselves,
saying: "We believe in the Rabb of the Worlds,
the Rabb of Musa (Moses) and Haroon (Aaron)."

Fir'on shouted: "How dare you believe in him before I give you
			permission? He must be your master who taught you the witchcraft.
			But soon you shall find out. I will cut off your hands and your
			feet on opposite sides and crucify you all."
They replied: "We don't care! We are going to return to our Rabb\n\t\t\tanyway.
We only desire that our Rabb may forgive us our sins, as we are\n\t\t\tthe first to believe."
We revealed to Musa (Moses), saying: "Set off with my servants by\n\t\t\tnight and beware that you will be pursued."
Fir'on (Pharaoh) sent heralds to all the cities,
and to mobilize his people he said: "These Israelites are but a\n\t\t\thandful of people,
who have provoked us much;
while we have a large army, well prepared."
Thus did We make them leave their gardens and their water\n\t\t\tsprings,
their treasures and sumptuous dwellings.
This is how they were made to lose, while on the other hand We\n\t\t\tmade the Children of Israel inheritors of such things.
At sunrise the Egyptians pursued them.
When the two hosts came face to face, the companions of Musa\n\t\t\tcried out: "We are surely overtaken."
Musa said: "Not at all! My Rabb is with me; He will show me a way\n\t\t\tout."
Then We revealed Our will to Musa: "Strike the sea with your\n\t\t\tstaff," and the sea was cleft asunder, each part stood like a\n\t\t\tmighty mountain.
We made the other party (Fir'on and his army) follow them.
We delivered Musa and all who were with him;
and drowned the others.
Surely there is a lesson in this: yet most of these people do not\n\t\t\tlearn this lesson to become believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
Narrate to them the story of Ibrahim,
when he asked his father and his people: "What is that which you\n\t\t\tworship?"
They replied: "We worship idols, and sit beside them with all\n\t\t\tdevotion."
Ibrahim asked: "Do they hear you when you call on them?
Can they help you or harm you?"
They replied: "No! But we found our forefathers doing so."
Ibrahim said: "Have you ever seen with open eyes these which you\n\t\t\thave been worshipping
- you and your forefathers?
They are all enemies to me; except the Rabb of the Worlds,
Who created me, then He gave me guidance.
He is the One Who gives me food and drink,
Who gives me health when I get sick,
Who will cause me to die and then bring me back to life,
Who, I hope, will forgive me my mistakes on the Day of Judgment."
After this, Ibrahim prayed: "O my Rabb! Bestow wisdom upon me and\n\t\t\tadmit me among the righteous,
grant me a reputation of truthfulness on the tongue of later\n\t\t\tgenerations,
count me among the inheritors of the paradise of Bliss;
forgive my father, for he is from among those who have gone\n\t\t\tastray,
do not hold me up in shame on the Day when everybody will be\n\t\t\traised back to life
- the Day when neither wealth nor sons will avail anyone,
and when none shall be saved except him who will come before\n\t\t\tAllah with a pure heart,
when paradise shall be brought in the sight of the righteous;
while hell shall be spread open to the straying
and they will be asked: "Now, where are those whom you worshipped
besides Allah? Can they help you or even help themselves?"
Then they will be toppled into it, both they and those who misled\n\t\t\tthem,
together with all the armies of Iblees.
Wherein they will argue with one another
saying: " By Allah, we were indeed in manifest error,
when we made you equals with the Rabb of the Worlds.
It was the criminals who led us astray.
Now we have no intercessors,
and no loving friends.
If we could but once return to our worldly life, we would be of\n\t\t\tthe true believers."
Surely in this narration there is a great lesson, but most of\n\t\t\tthese people do not learn a lesson to become believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
The people of Nuh, also, rejected the Rasools.
Remember when their brother Nuh asked them: "Have you no fear of\n\t\t\tAllah?
Rest assured that I am a trustworthy Rasool of Allah towards you,
so fear Allah and obey me.
I do not ask you any reward for my services, for my reward will\n\t\t\tbe given by the Rabb of the Worlds,
so fear Allah and obey me."
They replied: "Should we believe in you, whereas your followers\n\t\t\tare but the lowest of the low?"
He said: "I have no knowledge as to what they have been doing;
their account is the concern of my Rabb, if you could use your\n\t\t\tcommon sense!
I am not going to drive away any believer .
I am nothing but a plain Warner."
They said: "O Nuh! If you do not stop, you shall be stoned to\n\t\t\tdeath."
Nuh prayed: "O Rabb! My people have disobeyed me.
Decide the case between me and them openly. Deliver me and the\n\t\t\tbelievers who are with me."
So We granted his prayer, delivered him and those with him in the\n\t\t\tladen ark,
and drowned the rest in the flood.
Surely in this story there is a great lesson, but most of these\n\t\t\tpeople do not learn a lesson and become believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
The people of 'Ad, too, disbelieved their Rasools.
Remember when their brother Hud asked them: "Have you no fear of\n\t\t\tAllah?
Rest assured that I am a trustworthy Rasool of Allah towards you.
So fear Allah and obey me.
I do not ask you any reward for my services, for my reward will\n\t\t\tbe given by the Rabb of the Worlds.
Are you erecting a monument on every high place for fun?
Are you building strong fortresses as if you are going to live\n\t\t\there forever?
Whenever you lay your hands on anyone, you act like cruel\n\t\t\ttyrants.
Have fear of Allah and obey me.
Fear the One Who has given you all the things that you know.
He has given you flocks and children,
gardens and fountains.
Truly I fear for you the torment of a dreadful Day."
They replied: "It is the same to us whether you preach us or you\n\t\t\tare not one of the preachers.
Such preaching is nothing but an ancient myth.
We are not going to be punished."
So they disbelieved him and We utterly destroyed them. Surely in\n\t\t\tthis story there is a great lesson, but most of these people do\n\t\t\tnot learn a lesson and become believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
The people of Thamud also disbelieved their Rasools.
Remember when their brother Saleh asked them: "Have you no fear\n\t\t\tof Allah?
Rest assured that I am a trustworthy Rasool of Allah towards you.
So fear Allah and obey me.
I do not ask you any reward for my services, for my reward will\n\t\t\tbe given by the Rabb of the Worlds.
Will you be left in peace to enjoy all that you have here\n\t\t\tforever?
Gardens and fountains,
cornfields and palm-trees laden with juicy fruit,
carving your dwellings in the mountains and leading a happy life?
Have fear of Allah and obey me.
Do not follow the bidding of extravagant,
who create corruption in the land and reform nothing."
They replied: "You are but one of the bewitched!
You are no more than a human being like us. Bring forth a sign if\n\t\t\tyou are one of the truthful."
Saleh said: "Well, here is the she-camel (the sign that you asked\n\t\t\tfor). She shall have her share of water as you all have yours,\n\t\t\teach drinking on an alternate appointed day.
Do not touch her with evil, lest the punishment of a dreadful Day\n\t\t\tmay overtake you."
Yet they hamstrung her, then became full of regrets;
so the punishment overtook them. Surely in this story there is a\n\t\t\tgreat lesson, but most of these people do not learn a lesson and\n\t\t\tbecome believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
The people of Lut (Lot), also, disbelieved their Rasools.
Remember when their brother Lut asked them: "Have you no fear of\n\t\t\tAllah?
Rest assured that I am a trustworthy Rasool of Allah towards you.
So fear Allah and obey me.
I do not ask you any reward for my services, for my reward will\n\t\t\tbe given by the Rabb of the Worlds.
Will you fornicate with males from among the creatures of the\n\t\t\tworlds
and leave those whom your Rabb has created for you to be your\n\t\t\tmates? Nay! You are a people who have transgressed all limits."
They replied: "If you do not stop, O Lut, you shall become one of\n\t\t\tthe expelled."
Lut said: "I am certainly one of those who abhor your actions.
O Rabb! Deliver me and my family from their wicked deeds."
So We delivered him and all his family
except an old woman who was left among those who remained behind.
Then We utterly destroyed the rest.
We rained down on them the rain of brimstones: and evil was the\n\t\t\train which fell on those who were forewarned.
Surely in this story there is a great lesson, but most of these\n\t\t\tpeople do not learn a lesson and become believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
The people of Aiykah, also, disbelieved their Rasools.
Remember Shu'aib asked them: "Have you no fear of Allah?
Rest assured that I am a trustworthy Rasool of Allah towards you.
So fear Allah and obey me.
I do not ask you any reward for my services, for my reward will\n\t\t\tbe given by the Rabb of the Worlds.
Give full measure and be not of those who cause losses to others\n\t\t\tby fraud.
Weigh with even scales
and do not cheat your fellow men of what is rightly theirs: nor\n\t\t\tspread evil in the land.
Fear Him Who has created you and the generations before you".
They replied: "You are surely one of those who are bewitched.
You are no more than a human being like us and we think that you\n\t\t\tare lying.
Let a fragment fall out of the sky on us if you are telling the\n\t\t\tTruth".
Shu'aib said: "My Rabb has full knowledge of all your actions".
So they disbelieved him, and the torment of the day of darkness\n\t\t\t(dark clouds carrying Allah's scourge) seized them, and indeed it\n\t\t\twas the torment of an extremely dreadful day.
Surely in this story there is a great lesson, but most of these\n\t\t\tpeople do not learn a lesson and become believers.
The fact is that your Rabb is the Mighty as well as the Merciful.
Surely this Qur'an is a revelation from the Rabb of the Worlds.
The trustworthy Spirit (Angel Gabriel) brought it down
upon your heart so that you may become one of those who are\n\t\t\tappointed by Allah to warn the people
in a plain Arabic language.
This fact was foretold in the scriptures of the former people.
Is it not sufficient proof for the people that the learned men of\n\t\t\tthe children of Israel knew about it?
Even so that if We had revealed it to a non-Arab,
and he had recited it to them in fluent Arabic, they would still\n\t\t\tnot have believed in it.
We have thus caused unbelief in the hearts of the guilty.
They are not going to believe in it until they see the painful\n\t\t\tscourge
which, in their heedlessness, will come to them suddenly.
Then they will ask: "Can we be given some respite?"
Do they wish to hurry on Our scourge?
Just think! If We let them enjoy this life for many years,
and then the scourge with which they are threatened falls upon\n\t\t\tthem,
of what avail will their past enjoyments be to them?
Never have We destroyed a population to whom We did not send\n\t\t\tWarners;
they were forewarned, and We have never been unjust.
This Qur'an is not brought down by the shaitans:
it is neither in their interest nor in their power to produce\n\t\t\tsuch a masterpiece.
They are kept too far off to even hear it.
So do not call on other gods besides Allah, lest you become one\n\t\t\tof those who incur His punishment.
Admonish your close relatives
and lower your wing of kindness to those of the believers who\n\t\t\tfollow you,
but if they disobey, tell them: "I am not accountable for what\n\t\t\tyou do."
Put your trust in the All-Mighty, the Merciful,
Who observes you when you get up
and when you walk among those who prostrate themselves in\n\t\t\tworship.
He is the One Who hears all and knows all.
Shall I tell you, O people, on whom the shaitans descend?
They descend on every slandering sinner.
Those who listen to hearsay - and most of them are liars
- and those poets who are followed by those who go astray.
Do you not see, how aimlessly they wander in every valley,
preaching what they do not practice themselves?

However, an exception is made for those (poets) who believe, do
			good deeds, engage much in the remembrance of Allah and defend
			themselves when wronged, showing no vindictiveness. The unjust
			oppressors will soon find out what vicissitudes their affairs
			will take.
Tua Sin. These are verses of the Qur'an, the Glorious Book;
a guide and good news for the believers,
who establish the Salah (prayer) and pay the Zakah (charity) and\n\t\t\tfirmly believe in the hereafter.
As for those who do not believe in the hereafter, We make their\n\t\t\tdeeds seem fair to them, therefore they blunder about in their\n\t\t\tfolly.
They are the ones for whom there is an evil punishment, and in\n\t\t\tthe hereafter, they will be the greatest losers.
And O Muhammad, most surely you are receiving this Qur'an from\n\t\t\tthe One Who is wise and All-Knowing.

Relate to them the story of Musa (Moses), when he said to his
			family: "I have seen a fire; soon I may either bring you some
			information from there or a lighted torch to warm yourselves
			with."
When he came to it, a voice called out to him: "Blessed be He Who\n\t\t\tis in this fire and all around it! Glory be to Allah the Rabb of\n\t\t\tthe Worlds!
O Musa, this is Me, Allah, the All-Mighty, the Wise.

Throw down your staff." When he saw it moving like a snake, he
			turned back and fled and without even looking behind. "O Musa, do
			not be afraid," said Allah, "My Rasool need not be afraid in My
			presence,
unless, of course, he is guilty of wrongdoing; even then, if he\n\t\t\treplaces that wrongdoing with a good deed, I am indeed Forgiving,\n\t\t\tMerciful.

Now put your hand into your pocket, it will come out shining
			white without any harm. These two signs are from the nine signs
			that you will be given during your mission to Fir'on (Pharaoh)
			and his people; for truly, they are a people of transgressors."
But, when our signs were shown to them, they said: "This is clear\n\t\t\tsorcery."
They were convinced in their hearts about the truth of those\n\t\t\tmiracles, yet they denied those signs in their wickedness and\n\t\t\tpride. So you see, what was the end of those transgressors.
We bestowed knowledge on Dawood (David) and Sulaiman (Solomon).\n\t\t\tThey both said: "Praise be to Allah Who has exalted us above many\n\t\t\tof His believing servants."
Sulaiman succeeded Dawood. He said: "O people! We have been\n\t\t\ttaught the tongue of birds and given all sort of things. This is\n\t\t\tindeed a great blessing from Allah."
Sulaiman gathered an army comprised of Jinns, men and birds; they\n\t\t\tall were kept under strict discipline.

Once in an expedition he was marching with his army when they
			came across a valley of ants, one of the ants said: "O ants, get
			into your habitations lest Sulaiman and his army crush you under
			their feet without even noticing it."

So Sulaiman smiled, laughing at its statement, and said: "O Rabb!
			Inspire me to render thanks for Your favors, which You have
			bestowed on me and on my parents, to do such good deeds that will
			please You; and admit me, by Your mercy, among Your righteous
			servants."
He took a roll call of the birds and said: "I do not see the\n\t\t\thoopoe, where is he? How could he be absent?
I will certainly punish him severely or even slay him, if he does\n\t\t\tnot offer me a reasonable excuse for his absence."
The hoopoe, who did not take long in coming, said: I have just\n\t\t\tfound out that which you do not know. I have brought you reliable\n\t\t\tinformation about the people of Sheba.
I found that a woman is ruling over them, she has been given\n\t\t\teverything and she possesses a magnificent throne.

Further I found that she and her people prostrate themselves
			before the sun instead of Allah. Shaitan has made their deeds
			fair-seeming to them and thus turned them away from the Right
			Way, so that they may not be guided
to prostrate themselves before Allah, the One Who brings to light\n\t\t\tall that is hidden in the heavens and the earth and knows exactly\n\t\t\twhat you hide and what you reveal.
Allah! There is no god but Him. He is the Lord of the Mighty\n\t\t\tThrone."
Sulaiman said: "Soon we shall find out whether what you say is\n\t\t\ttrue or false.
Go and deliver to them this letter of mine, then turn aside and\n\t\t\twait for their answer."
The Queen said: "O my chiefs! A very important letter has been\n\t\t\tdelivered to me;
it is from Sulaiman, and it begins with the name of Allah, the\n\t\t\tCompassionate, the Merciful.
It reads: Do not be arrogant against me and come to me in\n\t\t\tcomplete submission (as a Muslim)."
Then she asked: "O chiefs! Let me hear your advice, for I make no\n\t\t\tdecision without your counsel."
They replied: "We are a valiant and mighty nation. You are the\n\t\t\tcommander. So we shall be waiting for your command."
The queen said: "When the kings invade a town, they ruin it and\n\t\t\tdebase its honorable people; and thus they always do.
Therefore, I shall send them a present and see with what reply my\n\t\t\tenvoys will return."

When the envoys of the queen came to Sulaiman, he said: "Do you
			want to provide me wealth? The wealth which Allah has given me is
			far more than what He has given you. You may very well keep your
			presents.

Go back to your people: if your people do not submit, we will
			march against them with such an army of which they shall never be
			able to face, and we shall drive them out of their land humbled
			and disgraced."

Later on when Sulaiman (Solomon) heard that the Queen of Sheba\n\t\t\twas coming in submission, he asked: "O my chiefs! Which of you\n\t\t\tcan bring to me her throne before they come to me in submission?"
One audacious from the Jinns said: "I will bring it to you before\n\t\t\tyou adjourn your court; and most surely I have the necessary\n\t\t\tstrength and I am trustworthy."

One person who had knowledge of the Book said: "I can bring it to
			you in the twinkling of an eye." As soon as Sulaiman saw the
			throne placed before him, he exclaimed: "This is by the grace of
			my Rabb to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful. Any who
			is grateful, surely his gratitude is a gain for his own soul, and
			any who is ungrateful should know that surely my Rabb is
			Self-Sufficient, Self-Exalted."
Further he said: "Without any comment to her, set her throne in\n\t\t\ther sight; let us see whether she recognize it or she is of those\n\t\t\twho cannot recognize the Truth."

So when the queen arrived, she was asked: "Is your throne like
			this?" She replied: "It looks as if it is the same; we had come
			to know that Sulaiman is not only a king but also a Prophet,
			therefore we have already become Muslims."
- Other deities whom she worshiped besides Allah had prevented\n\t\t\ther from believing, for she belonged to an unbelieving folk.

- Then she was asked to enter the palace. When she saw its floor,
			she thought that there was pool of water, so she tucked up her
			skirts uncovering her legs. Sulaiman said. "This is just a glossy
			paving of this palace." At this she exclaimed: "O my Rabb! I have
			indeed wronged my soul, now I submit myself in Islam with
			Sulaiman to Allah, the Rabb of the Worlds."
To the people of Thamud, We sent their brother Saleh, saying:\n\t\t\t"Worship Allah," but they divided themselves into two discordant\n\t\t\tfactions.
Saleh said: "O my people! Why do you wish to hasten towards evil\n\t\t\trather than good? Why do you not ask forgiveness of Allah so that\n\t\t\tyou may be shown mercy?"
They said: "We consider you and your companions a sign of bad\n\t\t\tluck." He said: "Your luck is with Allah; in fact, you are a\n\t\t\tpeople under trial."
There were nine ringleaders in the city who created mischief in\n\t\t\tthe land and reformed nothing.

They said to one another: "Let us pledge on oath by Allah that we
			shall make a secret night attack on him and his family, then we
			shall tell his guardian that we were not even present at the time
			his family was killed, and that we are telling the truth."
Thus they plotted a plan, and We too plotted a plan which they\n\t\t\tdid not perceive.
Just see what was the outcome of their plot! We annihilated them\n\t\t\tcompletely, together with all their people.
There lies their houses in desolate ruins as a result of their\n\t\t\twrongdoings. Verily in this story there is a lesson for those\n\t\t\tpeople who use their common sense.
Yet We delivered the true believers who were righteous.
Also mention to them of Lut (Lot), when he said to his people:\n\t\t\t"Do you commit indecency though you see its iniquity?
Do you approach men for your sexual desires instead women? The\n\t\t\tfact is that you are a people steeped in ignorance."
But his people gave no answer except that they said: "Drive out\n\t\t\tthe family of Lut from your city: they pose to be very pious."
So, We delivered him and his family except his wife - about whom\n\t\t\tWe had decreed that she shall be of those who will remain behind
- and We rained down on them a shower of brimstones, and evil was\n\t\t\tthe rain which fell on those who were forewarned.
Say: "Praise be to Allah and peace be on His servants whom He has\n\t\t\tchosen to deliver His message. Ask them: " Who is better? Allah\n\t\t\tor the deities they associate with Him?"

Is not He (Allah), Who has created the heavens and the earth,
			sends down rain from the sky and with it brings forth the
			beautiful gardens not better than the false gods that they
			worship? It is not in your ability to cause the growth of trees
			for those gardens. Is there another god besides Allah who could
			do that? No doubt they are a people who have swerved from justice
			in ascribing equals to Him.

Just think who has made the earth a place for your residence,
			caused in it the rivers to flow, set mountains upon it and placed
			a barrier between the two seas? Is there another god besides
			Allah? Nay, most of them have no knowledge.

Just think who answers the oppressed person when he cries out to
			Him and relieves his affliction, and makes you, O mankind,
			inheritors of the earth? Is there another god besides Allah? How
			little do you reflect!

Just think who guides you in darkness on the land and the sea,
			and who sends the winds as heralds of good news of His mercy? Is
			there another god besides Allah? Exalted be Allah above what they
			associate with Him!

Just think who originates creation and then repeats its
			production, and who gives you sustenance from the heavens and the
			earth? Is there another god besides Allah? Say: "Show us your
			proof if you are telling the truth!"
Say: No one in the heavens or in the earth has the knowledge of\n\t\t\tthe unseen except Allah and their gods do not know when they\n\t\t\tshall be raised to life again.
Their knowledge does not grasp the Hereafter; rather they are in\n\t\t\tdoubt about it; nay, they are blind concerning it!
The unbelievers say: "What! When we and our fathers have become\n\t\t\tdust, shall we really be raised from the dead?
This promise which is made to us was also made to our forefathers\n\t\t\tbefore us, these are nothing but the legends of primitive\n\t\t\tpeople."
Say: "Travel through the earth and see what has been the end of\n\t\t\tthe criminals."
O Prophet, do not worry about them nor feel distressed because of\n\t\t\ttheir plots.
They also say: "When will this promise be fulfilled if what you\n\t\t\tsay be true?"
Say: "It may be that a part of what you wish to hasten is near at\n\t\t\thand."
The fact is that your Rabb is very gracious to mankind: yet most\n\t\t\tof them are ungrateful.
Indeed your Rabb knows what their breasts conceal and what they\n\t\t\treveal.
Nor there is any secret in heaven or on earth which is not\n\t\t\trecorded in a clear Book.
In fact, this Qur'an clarifies for the Children of Israel most of\n\t\t\tthose matters in which they differ.
It is certainly a guide and blessing to true believers.
Surely your Rabb will decide between them by His judgement, He is\n\t\t\tthe All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.
Therefore, put your trust in Allah, for you are certainly on the\n\t\t\tmanifest Truth.
The fact is that you cannot make the dead hear you, nor can you\n\t\t\tmake the deaf hear the call especially when they turn their backs\n\t\t\tand pay no heed,
nor can you guide the blind people to prevent them from straying;\n\t\t\tnone will listen to you except those who believe in Our\n\t\t\trevelations and become Muslims.
When the time to fulfill Our word comes to pass, We will bring\n\t\t\tout from the earth a monster that shall speak to them, because\n\t\t\tthe people did not believe in Our revelations.
On that Day We shall gather from every nation a multitude of\n\t\t\tthose who disbelieved Our revelations; then they shall be\n\t\t\tarranged in classifications according to their merits,
until when they have all arrived, their Rabb will ask: "Did you\n\t\t\tdeny My revelations without gaining their comprehensive\n\t\t\tknowledge? If not this, what else were you doing?
The sentence will be carried out against them for the consequence\n\t\t\tof their wrongdoings and they will not be able to utter a word.
Do they not see that We have made the night for them to rest in,\n\t\t\tand the day to give them light? Surely there are signs in this\n\t\t\tfor the true believers.

On the Day, when the trumpet shall be blown and all who dwell in
			the heavens and the earth shall be terrified except those whom
			Allah will choose to spare, and all shall come to Him in utter
			humiliation,
these mountains which you see and think are firmly fixed, will\n\t\t\tpass away like clouds. Such is the might of Allah, Who has\n\t\t\tperfected all things. He is aware of what you do.
Those who have done good deeds shall be rewarded with what is\n\t\t\tbetter and shall be secure from the terror of that Day.
And those who have done evil deeds, shall be flung upon their\n\t\t\tfaces in the hellfire. Should you not be rewarded according to\n\t\t\tyour deeds?

O Muhammad, say to them: "I have been commanded to worship the
			Rabb of this city (Makkah), the One Who has made it sacred and
			Who is the Owner of all things; and I am commanded to be of those
			who are Muslims,
and that I should recite The Qur'an. Now, whoever follows this\n\t\t\tguidance will be guided for his own good, and to him who goes\n\t\t\tastray, say: "I am merely a Warner."
Then proclaim: "Praise be to Allah, very soon He will show you\n\t\t\tHis signs and you will recognize them. Your Rabb is not unaware\n\t\t\tof what you do."
Tua Sin M'im.
These are the verses of the Glorious Book that makes the things\n\t\t\tclear.
In all truth, We narrate to you some information about Musa\n\t\t\t(Moses) and Fir'on (Pharaoh) for the instruction of the\n\t\t\tbelievers.

The fact is that Fir'on elevated himself in the land and divided
			its residents into groups, one group of which he persecuted,
			putting their sons to death and sparing only their females.
			Indeed he was one of the mischief-makers.
But We wanted to favor those who were oppressed in the land, and\n\t\t\tmake them leaders, and make them the heirs,
establish them in the land, and show Fir'on, Haman and their\n\t\t\twarriors at their hands the same which they feared.

So We revealed Our will to the mother of Musa: "Suckle him, and
			when you feel any danger to his life, cast him into the river
			without any fear or grief; for We shall certainly restore him to
			you and make him one of Our Rasools."

We made Fir'on's family pick him up from the river: it was
			intended that Musa may become their adversary and a cause of
			their sorrow; for Fir'on, Haman and their warriors were all
			sinners.

The wife of Fir'on said: "This child may become the comfort of
			the eyes for me and for you. Do not kill him. He may prove useful
			to us or it may be that we will adopt him as our son." They were
			unaware of the result of what they were doing.

On the other hand, the heart of Musa's mother was sorely
			troubled. She would have disclosed as to who he was, had We not
			strengthened her heart so that she might become one of the true
			believers.
She said to Musa's sister: "Go, and follow him." So she (Musa's\n\t\t\tsister) watched him from a distance in such a way that the other\n\t\t\tdid not notice it.

We had already ordained that he would refuse to suck any foster
			mother. His sister came to Fir'on's wife and said: "Shall I point
			out to you a house whose people will take care of him for you and
			they will be sincere to him?"

Thus did We restore him to his mother that her eye might be
			comforted, that she might not grieve and that she might know that
			the promise of Allah is true. Yet most of the people do not
			understand.
When he reached maturity and became full-grown, We bestowed on\n\t\t\thim wisdom and knowledge. Thus do We reward the righteous.

One day he entered the city at a time when its, people were not
			yet active, he found two men reaching to each others throats; one
			was from his own race and the other of his foes. The man of his
			own race appealed for his help against his foe, thereupon Musa
			gave his foe a blow which killed him. On seeing what he has done
			he said: "This is the work of Shaitan, surely he is an enemy that
			openly misleads."
Then he prayed: "O my Rabb! I have indeed wronged my soul, please\n\t\t\tforgive me." So Allah forgave him, surely He is the Forgiving,\n\t\t\tthe Merciful.
Musa promised: "O my Rabb! After this favor that You have\n\t\t\tbestowed on me, I shall never be a helping hand to the\n\t\t\tcriminals."

Next morning as he was walking in the city in fear and caution,
			suddenly he saw the same man who he had helped the day before
			cried out to him again for help. Musa replied: "You are certainly
			a misguided person."

Then when Musa was about to lay his hands on a man who was an
			enemy to both of them, he cried out: "O Musa! Do you intend to
			kill me as you killed a person yesterday? You only want to become
			a tyrant in the land and have no intention of reforming
			anything."
At that time, there came a man running from the other end of the\n\t\t\tcity and said: "O Musa! The chiefs are plotting to kill you,\n\t\t\ttherefore, run away, surely I am your well wisher."
Hearing this, Musa left that place in fear and caution, praying:\n\t\t\t"O my Rabb! Deliver me from the nation of wrongdoers."
As he made his way towards Madyan, he said: "Soon my Rabb shall\n\t\t\tguide me to the Right Way."

When he arrived at the well of Madyan, he saw a multitude of men
			watering their flocks, and besides them two women who were
			keeping their flocks back. He asked: "What is the problem?" They
			replied: "We cannot water our flocks until the shepherds take
			away their flocks from the water, because we are weak and our
			father is a very old man."
So he watered their flocks for them and went back to the shade\n\t\t\tand prayed: "O Rabb! Surely I am in desperate need of whatever\n\t\t\tgood that You may send down to me."

Soon after that, one of the two women came to him walking
			bashfully and said: "My father is calling you. He wishes to
			reward you for watering our flocks for us." When Musa came to him
			and narrated his story, the old man said: "Have no fear. You have
			escaped from those wicked people."
One of the daughters said: "Father, hire this man. The best that\n\t\t\tone can hire is a man who is strong and trustworthy."

The old man said to Musa: "I am willing to give you one of my
			daughters in marriage if you stay in my service for eight years;
			but you may complete ten if you wish. I do not want to put you in
			trouble; Allah willing, you will find me one of the righteous."
Musa replied: "So be it an agreement between me and you.\n\t\t\tWhichever of the two terms I complete, let there be no compulsion\n\t\t\ton me. Allah is the witness to what we have agreed upon."

After completing the term of his agreement, when Musa (Moses) was
			travelling with his family, he saw a fire in the direction of
			Mount Tur. He said to his family: "Stay here, I saw a fire, I
			hope to bring some information from there or a lighted torch with
			which you may warm yourselves."
But when he reached there, a voice called out to him from the\n\t\t\tright side of the valley of the blessed spot from a tree ,\n\t\t\tsaying: "O Musa, surely I am Allah the Rabb of the Worlds."

Then Allah commanded, "Throw down your staff." When Musa saw that
			the staff was writhing like a snake, he turned his back and fled,
			and did not even look behind. Allah said, "O Musa, come back and
			do not fear; you are quite safe.

Now put your hand into your pocket: it will come out shining
			white without any harm to you - whenever you feel afraid, draw
			your hand towards yourself to ward off fear - these are two
			credentials from your Rabb towards Fir'on and his chiefs, surely
			they are wicked people."
Musa submitted: "Rabb! I have killed one of them: I fear that\n\t\t\tthey will put me to death.
My brother Haroon (Aaron), he is more eloquent in speech than I:\n\t\t\tsend him with me as a helper to confirm my words; I fear that\n\t\t\tthey will treat me as a liar."

Allah replied: "We will certainly strengthen your arm with your
			brother and give both of you such authority that they shall not
			be able to harm you. Now proceed with Our signs. You, and those
			who follow you, will surely triumph."

When Musa (Moses) came to them (Fir'on and his chiefs) with Our
			clear signs and invited them to Islam, they said: "This is
			nothing but baseless sorcery; we never heard such a thing in the
			time of our forefathers."
Musa stated: "My Rabb knows best who it is that comes with\n\t\t\tguidance from Him and who will gain the reward of the hereafter;\n\t\t\tsurely the wrongdoers will not attain felicity."

Fir'on said: "O Chiefs! You have no other god that I know of,
			except myself. O Haman! Bake for me bricks from clay and build me
			a high tower so that I may climb it to see the God of Musa; most
			surely I think him to be one of the liars."
He and his warriors were arrogant in the land without any right;\n\t\t\tthey thought that they would never be brought back to Us.
So We seized him and his warriors, and flung them into the sea.\n\t\t\tSee what was the end of wrongdoers?
We made them leaders who started calling people to hellfire, but\n\t\t\ton the Day of Resurrection they will not get any help.
We laid a curse on them in this world, and on the Day of\n\t\t\tResurrection they will be of the despised.
We gave Musa (Moses) the Book (Torah), after We had destroyed the\n\t\t\tformer generations, an eye opener, a guide, and a blessing so\n\t\t\tthat they may be reminded.
O Muhammad, you were not present on the western side of the\n\t\t\tmountain when We gave Musa the Law, nor did you witness that\n\t\t\tevent.

We raised many generations and a long time has passed over them;
			you were not living among the people of Madyan, reciting to them
			Our revelations; but it is We Who are sending to you the news of
			that time.

Nor were you at the side of the mountain of Tur when We called
			out to Musa, but it is your Rabb's mercy that you are being given
			this information so that you may forewarn a nation to whom no
			Warner had come before you. Maybe they will take heed,

so that they may not be able to say, when a disaster befalls them
			on account of their misdeeds: "Our Rabb, had You sent us a
			Rasool, we should have followed Your revelations and became the
			believers."

Now that the Truth has come to them from Us, they are saying:
			"Why is he (Muhammad) not given the like of what was given to
			Musa?" Have they not rejected that which was given to Musa
			before? They claim: "These (Torah and Qur'an) are the two works
			of sorcery complementing each other!" And they say: "We believe
			in neither."
Ask them: "Bring a Book from Allah which is a better guide than\n\t\t\tthese two, I will follow it, if what you say be true!"

So if they do not meet this demand, you should know that they
			only follow their own desires. And who is more misguided than the
			one who follows his own desires rather than the guidance from
			Allah? In fact, Allah does not guide such wrongdoing people.
We have conveyed Our Word to them over and over again in order\n\t\t\tthat they may take heed.
Those to whom the scriptures were given before this (Jews and\n\t\t\tChristians), they do recognize the Truth and believe in this\n\t\t\t(Qur'an).
When it is recited to them they say: "We believe in it, surely\n\t\t\tthis is the Truth from our Rabb: indeed we were Muslims even\n\t\t\tbefore this."
They are the ones who will be given their reward twice, because\n\t\t\tthey have endured with fortitude, repelling evil with good and\n\t\t\tgiving in charity out of what We have given them.
When they hear vain talk, they withdraw from it saying: "Our\n\t\t\tdeeds are for us and yours for you; peace be on to you: we do not\n\t\t\tdesire the way of ignorant."
O Prophet, you cannot give guidance to whom you wish, it is Allah\n\t\t\tWho gives guidance to whom He pleases, and He is quite aware of\n\t\t\tthose who are guided.

Those who do not wish to be guided say: "If we go along with you
			and accept this guidance, we shall be driven out from our land."
			But have We not given them a secure sanctuary to which are
			brought the fruits of all kinds as a provision from Us? But most
			of them have no knowledge.

How many towns have We destroyed who once flourished in their
			economy? Just see those dwellings of theirs, only a few of which
			have been inhabited after them; at last We Alone became their
			inheritors.

Your Rabb would never destroy the towns until He had sent in
			their metropolis a Rasool, proclaiming to them Our revelations;
			and We would not destroy towns except when their dwellers had
			become wrongdoers.

The things which you have been given are but the provisions and\n\t\t\tadornments of this worldly life; and that which is with Allah is\n\t\t\tbetter and more lasting. Why don't you use your common sense?

Can a person to whom We have made a handsome promise and he is
			sure to receive it, be like the one to whom We have only given
			the provisions of this world and he is scheduled to be presented
			on the Day of Resurrection for punishment?
Let them not forget that Day when We shall call them and ask:\n\t\t\t"Where are those whom you deemed to be My associates?"

Those who are proven guilty as charged will say: "Our Rabb! These
			are the ones whom we led astray; we led them astray as we were
			astray ourselves. However, we plead our innocence before You; it
			was not us that they worshipped."

Then they will be told: "Appeal to your shoraka' (associate\n\t\t\tgods)," so they will appeal them but will get no answer. They\n\t\t\twill see the punishment and wish that they had accepted guidance.
Let them also not forget that, on that Day, He will call them and\n\t\t\task: "How did you answer Our Rasools?"
They will be so confused on that Day that they will not even ask\n\t\t\tone another.
However, the one who has repented in this life, and believed, and\n\t\t\tdone good deeds may hope to be among those who will achieve\n\t\t\tsalvation.

Your Rabb creates whatever He wills and chooses for His work whom
			He pleases. It is not for them (mushrikin) to choose and assign
			the powers of Allah to whom they want. Glory be to Allah! He is
			far above the shirk that these people commit.
Your Rabb knows all that they conceal in their hearts and all\n\t\t\tthat they reveal.
He is Allah; there is no god but Him. Praise belongs to Him in\n\t\t\tthis world and in the hereafter: His is the Judgement and to Him\n\t\t\tyou all shall be brought back.

O Prophet, ask them: "Have you ever considered that if Allah were
			to make the night perpetual till the Day of Resurrection, which
			deity other than Allah could bring you light?" Will you not
			listen?

Ask them again: "Have you ever considered that if Allah were to
			make the day perpetual till the Day of Resurrection, which deity
			other than Allah could bring you the night in which you could
			rest? Will you not see?
It is out of His mercy that He has made for you the night that\n\t\t\tyou may rest in it, and the day that you may seek His bounty, so\n\t\t\tthat you may render thanks.
They should be mindful of that Day when He will call them and\n\t\t\task: "Where are those deities whom you deemed My associates?"

And We shall bring forth a witness from every nation and ask:
			"Bring your proof about other deities besides Me." Then they
			shall come to know that in reality there is only One God, Allah,
			and gods of their own inventions have left them in the lurch."

The fact is that Qarun (Korah) was one of Musa's people, but he
			rebelled against them. We had given him such treasures that their
			very keys were a heavy burden to a band of strong men. When his
			people said to him: "Do not exult, for Allah does not love the
			exultant.

Rather seek, by means of what Allah has given you, to attain the
			abode of the hereafter, while not neglecting your share in this
			world. Be good to others as Allah has been good to you, and do
			not seek mischief in the land, for Allah does not love the
			mischief makers."

He replied: "All that I have been given is by virtue of the
			knowledge that I possess." Did he (Qarun) not know that Allah had
			destroyed many people before, who were mightier in strength and
			greater in riches than him? But the criminals are not called to
			account immediately for their sins.

One day he came out before his people in his worldly glitter.\n\t\t\tThose who sought the life of this world said: "Would that we had\n\t\t\tthe like of Qarun's fortune! He is indeed a very lucky man."

But those who were endowed with knowledge said: "Alas for you!
			Better is the reward of Allah for him that has faith and does
			good deeds; but none shall attain it save those who endured with
			fortitude."
Then We caused the earth to swallow him, together with his\n\t\t\tdwelling, and he had no host to help him against Allah; nor was\n\t\t\the able to defend himself.

Now the same people who envied him for his lot the day before,
			began to say: "Alas! We had forgotten that it is indeed Allah Who
			enlarges the provision for whom He wills and restricts it from
			whom He pleases. If Allah had not been gracious to us, He could
			have caused the earth to swallow us too. Alas! We did not
			remember that the disbelievers never attain felicity."
As for the abode of the Hereafter, We have reserved it for those\n\t\t\twho seek neither glory nor corruption in the earth; the ultimate\n\t\t\tgood is for the righteous.

Anyone who brings a good deed shall have something even better;
			while anyone who brings an evil deed will find that those who
			perform evil deeds will be punished only to the extent of their
			misdeeds.

O Prophet, rest assured that He Who charged you with The Qur'an\n\t\t\twill bring you to the best destination. Say: "My Rabb best knows\n\t\t\thim who has brought guidance and him who is in manifest error."

You (O Muhammad) never expected that the Book would be revealed\n\t\t\tto you. Only through your Rabb's mercy has it been revealed to\n\t\t\tyou: therefore do not be a helper in any way to the unbelievers.

Let no one turn you away from the revelations of Allah now that\n\t\t\tthey have been revealed to you. Invite people to your Rabb and be\n\t\t\tnot of the mushrikin (who join other deities with Allah).
Invoke no other god besides Allah. There is no god but Him.\n\t\t\tEverything is perishable except Him. To him belongs the judgement\n\t\t\tand to him will you all be returned.
Alif Lam M'im.
Do the people think that they will be left alone on saying "We\n\t\t\tbelieve," and that they will not be tested?
We did test those who have gone before them. Allah has to see\n\t\t\t(for the purpose of reward and punishment) who are the truthful\n\t\t\tand who are the liars.
Or do the evildoers think that they will escape from Our reach?\n\t\t\tHow bad is their judgment!
He that hopes to meet Allah must know that Allah's appointed time\n\t\t\tis sure to come and He hears all and knows all.
He that strives, does that for his own soul; for Allah is\n\t\t\tcertainly transcendent and beyond any need of the worlds.
As for those who believe and do good deeds, We shall cleanse them\n\t\t\tof their sins and We shall reward them according to the best of\n\t\t\ttheir deeds.

We have enjoined man to show kindness to his parents; but if they
			(your parents) force you to commit shirk with Me, of which you
			have no knowledge, do not obey them. To Me is your return and I
			will inform you of what you have done.
Those who have accepted the true faith and do good deeds shall be\n\t\t\tadmitted among the righteous.

There are some among people, who say: "We believe in Allah;" yet
			when they suffer in the cause of Allah they confuse the
			persecution of people with the punishment of Allah. But when
			there comes help in the shape of a victory from your Rabb, they
			are sure to say: "We have always been with you." Is not Allah
			fully aware of what is in the hearts of the people of the world?
Most surely Allah knows those who believe and knows those who are\n\t\t\tthe hypocrites.
The unbelievers say to the believers: "Follow us, and we will\n\t\t\tbear the burden of your sins". But they will not bear any burden\n\t\t\tof their sins; they are surely lying.

Of course, they shall bear their own burdens as well as the\n\t\t\tburdens of others in addition to their own; and on the Day of\n\t\t\tResurrection they shall be questioned about their invented lies.
We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people and he lived among them a\n\t\t\tthousand years less fifty. Then because of their wrongdoings the\n\t\t\tflood overtook them.
But We delivered him and all who were in the ark and We made that\n\t\t\tark a sign for the peoples of the world.
Likewise Ibrahim (Abraham), when he said to his people: "Worship\n\t\t\tAllah and fear Him, this is better for you if you understand.

You worship idols besides Allah and fabricate falsehood. In fact,
			those whom you worship besides Allah have no power to give you
			your sustenance, therefore seek your sustenance from Allah, and
			worship Him. Give thanks to Him, for to Him you shall be
			returned.
If you deny the Message, then nations have denied before you .\n\t\t\tThe only duty a Rasool has is to deliver Allah's Message\n\t\t\tclearly."
Do they not see how Allah originates creation then repeats its\n\t\t\tprocess? Surely it is easy for Allah.
Say to them: "Travel through the earth and see how Allah\n\t\t\toriginates the creation, then creates the later creation. Surely\n\t\t\tAllah has power over everything.
He punishes whom He wills and shows mercy to whom He pleases, and\n\t\t\tto Him you shall be turned back.
Neither can you frustrate Him in the earth or in the Heaven; nor\n\t\t\thave you any protector or helper besides Allah."

As for those who disbelieve Allah's revelations and deny that\n\t\t\tthey will ever meet Him, they are the ones who shall despair of\n\t\t\tMy mercy and they the ones who shall have a painful punishment.

The people of Ibrahim (Abraham) had no answer except to say:
			"Kill him!" Or "Burn him!" But Allah saved him from the fire when
			they tried to burn him. Surely in this incidence there are signs
			for those who believe.

After coming out from the fire safely, Ibrahim addressed them:
			"Today you have made idols, instead of Allah, a means of
			affection among yourselves. Remember, on the Day of Resurrection
			you shall disown and curse one another. Fire shall be your abode
			and you shall have no helper."

Witnessing this whole incident, Lut (Lot) affirmed his belief
			with Ibrahim. Finally Ibrahim said: "I will migrate towards my
			Rabb (go where my Rabb has bidden me). He is the Mighty, the
			Wise."

We gave him Ishaq (Isaac - a son) and Ya'qoob (Jacob - a
			grandson), and placed the Prophethood and the Book in his progeny
			- thus We gave him his reward in this life, and in the hereafter
			he will surely be among the righteous.
When Lut (Lot) said to his people: "Surely you are committing\n\t\t\tsuch sexual misconduct as no one in the worlds has ever attempted\n\t\t\tbefore you.

Do you lust after males, commit robbery on the highways and
			commit evil deeds even in your assemblies?" His people had no
			answer except to say: "Bring us the scourge of Allah if you are
			truthful."
Lut prayed: "O Rabb! Help me against this degenerate nation."

When Our Messengers (angels) came to Ibrahim (Abraham) with the
			good news (the birth of a son in his old age), they said: "We are
			to destroy the people of that township, for its people are indeed
			wrongdoers."
Ibrahim said: "But Lut is in there." The angels replied: "We know\n\t\t\twho is in there: we shall certainly save him and his family,\n\t\t\texcept his wife, who will remain behind!"

And when Our Messengers (angels) came to Lut he became sad and
			anxious on their account, for he felt powerless to protect them.
			But they said "Do not fear nor grieve (we are the angels assigned
			for their torment): we shall save you and your family except your
			wife; she will be of those who will remain behind.
We are going to bring down a scourge from heaven upon the people\n\t\t\tof this town on account of their transgression."
Surely We have left a clear sign from it (the ruins of this town)\n\t\t\tfor people who care to understand.
To the people of Madyan We sent their brother Shu'aib, who said:\n\t\t\t"O my people! Worship Allah and look forward to the Last Day, and\n\t\t\tdo not transgress in the land wickedly."
But they denied him, so a severe earthquake seized them and by\n\t\t\tthe morning they were lifeless bodies in their own homes.

Likewise We destroyed the people of 'Ad and the Thamud: you have
			seen the traces of their dwellings. Shaitan had made their foul
			deeds fair-seeming to them and diverted them from the Right Way,
			though they were intelligent people.
Musa (Moses) came to Qarun (Korah), Fir'on (Pharaoh) and Haman\n\t\t\twith clear signs but they remained arrogant in the land; yet they\n\t\t\tcould not go ahead of Us.

We seized all of them for their sinfulness: against some We sent
			a violent tornado full of stones, some were seized by a mighty
			blast, some were swallowed up by the earth, and yet some We
			drowned. It was not Allah Who was unjust to them, but they were
			unjust to their own souls.

The parable of those who take protectors other than Allah is that
			of a spider who builds for itself a dwelling, and surely the
			weakest of all dwellings is the dwelling of a spider, if they but
			knew it.
Surely Allah knows whoever they invoke besides Him; He is the\n\t\t\tAll-Mighty, the Wise.
These are the parables that We cite for mankind; but none will\n\t\t\tgrasp them except the wise.
